loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is married with four children.  She is 65-years-old and lives in Mialen Clarin, Philippines.

Paz is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional farming equipment.

Paz has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Paz hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional farming equipment

loans.name: Ma. Rosa

texts.en:
Ma. Rosa is 51-years-old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school. 

Ma. Rosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Rosa requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Rosa has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alonso Ramiro

texts.es: Alonso es un señor casado que vive con su esposa y con sus 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estan estudiando, Alonso se dedica a la agricultura y su esposa a la crianza de animales menores  y comenta que le va bien en estas actividades, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para tener en buen estado a sus cultivos de los que piensa tener una buena cosecha para los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Alonso is a married man who lives with his wife and their five children, three of whom go to school.  Alonso makes his living in agriculture, and his wife raises small animals.  He says that both businesses are going well.  Alonso will invest the loan in the purchase of compost and fungicides so his crop will be in good condition.  He expects to get a good harvest that will meet the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fungicides.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos. Èl se dedica a la agricultura y a la artesania y su esposa a la ceramica mientras sus hijos van a la escuela.

 Carlos desde muy joven a sido un hombre de trabajo en la epoca lluviosa se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y ademas él ayuda a su esposa en su oficio de ceramicas.

Con su crédito comprara abono,maiz,herbicidas y fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha y asi al vender el producto obtendra mejores ingresos.

El sueño de Carlos a futuro es seguir trabajando la tierra para seguir cosechando los granos básicos y que no les falte nada a su familia, quiere que sus hijos sean personas trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32-years old.  He lives with his wife and their six children.  He makes his living in agriculture and handicrafts.  His wife makes her living in handicrafts, and the children go to school. 

Since he was very young, Carlos has been a very hard-worker.  In the rainy season, he dedicates himself to planting staple grains.  In addition, he helps his wife in her ceramics profession. 

With his loan, Carlos will purchase compost, corn, herbicides and fertilizers so he can get a better harvest and, when it comes time to sell his products, earn a better income. 

Carlos's hope for the future is to keep working the land and to keep harvesting his staple grains so that his family lacks for nothings.  He wants for his children to be hard-working people.

loans.use: to purchase compost, corn, herbicides and fertilizers to get a better harvest and then, when he sells his product, to earn a better income.

loans.name: Thoeurt's Group

texts.en: Thoeurt is a resident of Moung Russey of Battambang province. She is a 39-year-old woman who is still single. Thoeurt is a farmer who struggles to earn a living from paddy rice farming which she has occupied for about 18 years already.  This is the first time for Thoeurt to request a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is the leader of a group of three borrowers. The total entire group's loan amount is 3,200,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer, pay for land plowing fees and labor fees for her crop farm. She optimistically hopes that she will be able to improve her living condition through the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for land plowing fees and labor fees

loans.name: Mut's Group

texts.en: Moung Russey district of Battambang province is the home to Mut and her family. She is a 63-year-old married woman and mother of nine children. For her entire family, rice cropping on a two hectare and half area is the single source of her income. She has been engaged in the agribusiness for about 30 years.  Mut has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages with successful repayment. Her living conditions are getting better than before. Now, she leads a group of three members to request a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The group seeks a loan of 3,400,000 KHR and Mut owns the portion of 1,400,000 KHR of the loan. As a group leader, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pay for land plowing fees and labor fees for her crop farm. She strongly hopes that the loan will unlock a way for her to earn a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for land plowing fees and labor fees

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna, 28, is a villager of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province where her two hectares of rice farm is located.  She is a rice grower who can earn up to almost 34,000 KHR per day to cover her daily cost of living. This is the second cycle for her to seek with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Vanna has completely repaid the past loan and it has enabled her to improve her family situation better than before. Now, she leads a group of three members to request a loan of 2,700,000 KHR, of which she owns a portion of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use her portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that she will be able to earn a higher income than before.

loans.use: to buy crop seed and fertilizer

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
José tiene 59 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida, quien se dedica a los oficios domesticos, ademas vive con sus dos hijos de edades de 9 y 15 años, ellos estudian en el centro escolar de la comunidad.

José estudio hasta 4° grado y no siguio por motivos economicos, ya que era muy dificel para sus padres pagarle el estudio.

Él trabja como guardia de seguridad en la represa hidroelectrica del departamento desde hace varios años, tambien en sus dias libres trabaja en la agricultura cultivando maiz y frijol, oficio que lo aprendio de su padre desde que tenia 10 años de edad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos sacos de urea, tres sacos de sulfato de amonio y una caneca de herbicida, para cultivar maíz y frijol. Con estos insumos mejorara la produccion de granos básicos.

El sueño de él, es seguir produciendo granos básicos, ya que es una forma de tener un poco de alimento para el hogar.
texts.en:
José is 59 years old and lives with his life-partner, who takes care of the domestic chores, and he also lives with his two sons who are 9 and 15 years old and who go to school in the community’s educational center. José studied up to the 4th grade and he did not continue due to economical reasons, as it was very difficult for his parents to pay for his schooling. 

He works, for several years now, as a security guard in the department’s hydroelectric dam. Furthermore, on his days off he works in agriculture cultivating corn and beans, a job that he learned from his father since he was 10 years old. 

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy two sacks of urea, three sacks of ammonium sulfate, and a flask of herbicide to cultivate bean and corn. With these inputs, he will improve upon the production of the basic grains. 

His dream is to continue producing basic grains because it is a way to have a little bit of food for the home.

loans.use: to buy two urea sacks, tree ammonium sulfate sacks, and an herbicide flask to cultivate bean and corn.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos de peluquería como tratamientos capilares, tintes, esmaltes, etc. Inicio el negocio hace 2 meses y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.
El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar aun mas sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio. El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como siliconas para el cabello e insumos para peluqueros como cuchillas y enjuagues capilares.
Tiene grandes esperanzas en él y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Juan is a man with a lot of willingness to confront the world and have a full life as a result of his efforts. He has a store where he sells hairdressing products like hair treatments, hair dye, nail polish, etc.

He started it two months ago, and in spite of being in the business for a short period of time, he has had a good reception in the market. 

He wishes to offer more products and improve his sales by putting more capital in the business. He is requesting a loan so he can give himself the opportunity of being independent, and have enough reasons to fully dedicate to his business. 

The money will be used to buy merchandise that he doesn’t have right now, like silicones and supplies for hair stylists (razor blades and cream rinse). 

He has a lot of faith on himself, and believes that his future can improve considerably thanks to the support of organizations that make it possible for people to dream about a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn and thus achieve his harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and versatile energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en: A father of two little kids who resides in Sangke district of Battambang province, Sinat secures the basic needs in her family via rice farming and his paid working job earns him about 18,700 KHR per day. Sinat has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for seven cycles already. He has successfully repaid past loans and it has enabled him to improve the living condition of his family. Now, he leads a group of four members to seek a loan of 3,800,000 KHR, of which 300,000 KHR is his loan portion. As a group leader, he plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees for his crop farm. He hopes that the loan will allow him to expand his current farming business as he works very hard to increase the income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley has been in the farming business in Nakuru. He has been doing so well with a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is married and blessed with two school-going children.

He has applied for his third loan of KES 45,000, which he will use to buy farm inputs and livestock to raise. .He will use the anticipated profits to provide the basic needs for his family.

In the future, he will grow his business and venture into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and livestock

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon has been operating a water-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan that has helped her to support her business. 

Sharon is requesting a loan to purchase gallons of water for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of water for the business

loans.name: Fanaka Kajiungeni Group

texts.en:
Raubati is in his early thirties and has  three children; two attend school and the third is young. He is married and has supported his family by operating a shop to sell rice, flour, and sugar. He works from 7:00am to 8:30pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This will be his sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He successfully repaid the previous loans which he used to replenish his inventory. He earned a profit which he used to cover school fees and home expenses. He dreams of buying land to build a house. Raubati will use this loan to start selling spare parts for cars.

He will share this loan with his loan group"Fanaka Kajiungeni" which is comprised of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying the loan.

loans.use: to begin a spare parts business.

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad y vive con su hija de 20 años, quien se dedica a los oficios domesticos, hace un año quedo viudo. José solo se dedica a la agricultura y cuida de trece cabezas de ganado.

Desde que tenia doce años trabaja la agricultura,  luego decidio dedicarse a la crianza de ganado dese hace 14 años,  esto lo motivo cuando recibio una indemnizacion y con eso logro comenzar con dos vacas luego a ido creciendo poco a poco.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres sacos de sulfato de amonio, tres canecas de herbicidas y lo demas lo utilizara para pagar mano de obra y sembrar maíz.

Su sueño,  es mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija y la de seguir cosechando los granos básicos, para que no les haga falta el alimento en el hogar.
texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old and lives with his 20 year old daughter who is engaged in domestic duties.  A year ago, he became a widower. José is dedicated to agriculture and cares for thirteen head of cattle.

Since he was twelve, he has been a farmer. Later, he decided to devote himself to raising cattle for the past 14 years ago.  This motivated him when he received an insurance payment.  And with that, he started with two cows and little by little grew his herd.

The loan he is requesting is to buy three bags of ammonium sulfate, three cans of herbicides, and to pay for labor and plant corn.

His dream is to improve the quality of life for his daughter and to continue harvesting basic grains so that they do not lack food at home.

loans.use: to buy bags of ammonium sulfate, cans of  herbicides  and to pay for labor and plant corn.

loans.name: Cordula Teresa Nunila

texts.es: A sus 60 años de edad Teresa se dedica a la agricultura juntamente con su esposo y también cría animales menores, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales uno de 26 años está asistiendo a la universidad y también trabaja para cubrir sus gastos de estudio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de fungicidas,  abono y pago de mano de abra para mejorar sus cultivos, Teresa aspira seguir adelante en sus cultivos y de estos ingresos ayudar a su hijo que está estudiando y a sus 2 nietos que más lo necesitan.
texts.en: At 60 years old, Teresa makes a living from agriculture, alongside her husband, and she also raises small animals. She has seven children, one of which is a 26 year old attending university and also working in order to cover his education expenses. She will invest the credit to purchase fungicides, manure, and labor work to improve her crops. Teresa aspires to move forward with her crops, and from the revenues help her son who is studying and her two grandchildren who need it the most.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides

loans.name: Bayartsengel

texts.en:
Bayartsengel, 31 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the eastern most town of Mongolia. He has worked as a sales manager at a private company since 2010. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, looking after their children. 

The house they live in has deteriorated. He requests 1,500,000 MNT to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 52 years old. He did not have the financial resources to finish school. He is married and his wife works with him in his business.

Ruel raises pigs and has done this work since he was very young. 

Ruel requests this loan from GDMPC to buy feed.

In the future, he wants to have a better house  and give his family a better future. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Sardiana

texts.en: Sardiana, a mother of three, has managed a general store for ten years and earns well to support her husband’s income. She has sustained it with the support of the entire family. The couple wants to provide a better education for their children so, with this, she has to work more for it. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 28-year-old married woman from Gaza city. She has two sons and a daughter. 

She has a small grocery store in the city to sell grocery products. She would like to improve her store and expand it. 

Huda took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy sugar, oil and rice. By taking this loan, Huda will be able to improve her store and increase the sales. 

Huda appears in the photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a 43-year-old married woman from Tubas, a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother for two kids, a son and a daughter. She has a small grocery store in the village where she sells regular grocery products. She would like to improve her store and expand it. Nida took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more items for her grocery store like sugar, oil and rice. By taking this loan, Nida will be able to improve her store and increase the sales. Nida appears in the photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more items for her grocery store like sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is 45 years old and she is happily married to Henry. God has blessed them with two children. Life, indeed, is hard. But, by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Lilia owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a 5 Php-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per-piece for a higher price to have a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns Php 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan assistance. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Aside from her variety store, Jocelyn  also owns and operate a jeepney unit. She hopes for continuous progress for her business and she desires to have enough savings to provide for all the needs of the family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and make improvements in the cookhouse

loans.name: Santiago Javier

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 49 años de edad, estudio bachillerato, se caso y es padre de dos hijos, su esposa trabaja en una escuela impartiendo clases y sus hijos estudian bachillerato, mientras Santiago se dedica a prestar sus servicios como ordenanza en un instituto y en su tiempo libre realiza labores agricolas.

Necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agricolas como semilla de maiz, abono y hierbicidas y tambien para invertir en una tienda que por las tardes administra su esposa.

En un futuro sueña con mejorar sus ingresos, para  pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santiago, 49, studied through high school. He is married and a father of two children. His wife is a teacher and his kids are in high school. Santiago is an administrative assistant at a high school and in his free time he farms.

He needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizer and herbicides, as well as to invest in the store that his wife runs in the afternoons. In the future he dreams of improving his income so that he can pay for his children to go to college.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and herbicides as well as to invest in the store that his wife manages in the afternoons.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, es divorciada, vive junto a su hija de 22 años, ambas desempeñan el trabajo de siembra y venta de plantas ornamentales y árboles frutales, con la ayuda de créditos ha progresado en su negocio, su experiencia le ayuda a tener una buena administración del mismo, de muy joven aprendió de su padre técnicas para sembrar y cuidar plantas, anteriormente fue empleada pero hoy se dedica solo a atender el negocio. 
Comprará plantas, semillas, tierra, canastas, masetas, abono, bolsas, entre otros materiales necesarios para realizar sus actividades, espera atraer nuevos clientes, tener mejores ingresos que sean de apoyo para cancelar su deuda y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Su sueño es contar con un negocio más popular que siga generando ganancias para salir adelante y que su hija aprenda a administrarlo.
texts.en:
Maria is divorced, she lives with her 22-year-old daughter, and both of them carry out the work of planting and selling ornamental plants and fruit trees. With the help of loans, progress has been made with her business; her experience helps her have a good administration of it. 

Since she was very young, she learned from her father techniques to plant and take care of plants. She had been previously employed but today she makes a living from her business. She will buy plants, seeds, soil, baskets, flowerpots, manure, bags, among other materials that are necessary to conduct her business. She hopes to attract new customers, have better revenues that will help to cancel her debts and meet the needs of the home. 

Her dream is to have a more popular business that will continue to generate the profits to get ahead and for her daughter to learn to manage it.

loans.use: to buy plants, seeds, soil, baskets, flowerpots, bags, among other materials.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 58 years old and married with six children, one of whom in school. Ma. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elena runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 46 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 50 years old and has three children. Ma. Fe is married and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Fe is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Ma. Fe has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Sangke district, Houn is a 55-year-old widow with six children. The main sources of the family’s income is growing vegetables and raising chickens. She has done this for 3 years. She earns about 20,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the fourth loan for Houn with VisionFund. She successfully repaid the loan and is leading her group to apply for another loan. Houn wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her plantation and chicken feed for her chicken business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her plantation.

loans.name: Yoeurt's Group

texts.en:
The Sangke district of Battambang province is the home of Yoeurt and her family, which consists of seven children. 

She meets her daily expenses by growing rice and working another job. This business generates about 37,500 KHR per day. 

Her first loan was repaid with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and it enabled her to gradually raise her standard of living. Now, she is the leader of a group of three. She and a co-borrower seek 1,000,000  KHR and a remaining borrower is applying for 1,500,000 KHR. 

As a leader, she plans to use the loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the plowing fee of her farm. She hopes that she will be able to produce a higher yield so that she can expand her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay to have the field plowed.

loans.name: Sreyvorn's Group

texts.en:
Sreyvorn is aged 59 years old and widowed. She is a mother of six children. To make a living, she and her husband have been raising pigs for three years and supplement their family’s income by planting rubber trees. To better support her big family, they sometimes work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day.
Sreyvorn has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and she completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to resell.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en: Thea is a 34-year-old married woman who is living in Borvel district of Battambang province. She is also a mother of two dependent children, one of her children is currently going to school and the other one is under school-age. The only source of income for her family comes from paddy rice farming, which she has been doing for about eight years already, and it returns her about 37,000 KHR per day. Thea has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for past cycles three already. She has completely repaid past loans and it has unlocked a way for her to pass the hardship that her family has faced. Now, she leads a group of two borrowers to request for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR which will contribute to an equal share of 2,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she plans to use her portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to use on her crop farm. She hopes that the loan will allow her to continue uplifting her family’s living condition at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Samoeuy's Group

texts.en: Samoeuy, 53, is a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. With a big family consisting of nine children, she struggles to earn a living via pig-raising as single source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 25 years, earning about 33,000 KHR per day. This is the sixth cycle for Samoeuy as a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully repaid the past loan and it allows her to improve the situation of her family progressively. Now, she leads a group of two members to request for a loan of 2,800,000 KHR which will contribute to an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR each.  As the representative of her group, she will use the loan to buy pig feed and to pay for the vaccine fees for her pigs. She hopes that she will be able to support her business on time through the loan so that she can uplift her living condition gradually.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and to pay for pig vaccines.

loans.name: Mesa's Group

texts.en:
Mesa is aged 40 years old and single. To make a living, she has been growing beans and selling tofu for ten years. The current business earns her about 80,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Mesa has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Mesa wants to use her portion to buy bean seeds for growing. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for growing.

loans.name: Diana Francisca

texts.es: Diana tiene 23 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hija de 4 años de edad. Diana y su esposo se ganan la vida por medio del cultivo de hortalizas como: espinaca, cilantro y mora. Son personas trabajadoras y muy responsables. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto, para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, ladrillo, arena hierro, etc.
texts.en:
Diana, 23, lives in her own home along with her husband and their 4 year old daughter. Diana and her husband work as farmers, growing things like spinach, cilantro and blackberries. They are hardworking and responsible.

Diana wants to improve her living conditions and so she asked for a loan from FUSAI to build another room, for which she needs materials like cement, bricks, iron, sand, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron, etc to build a room.

loans.name: Kafedha

texts.en:
Kafedha is a divorced woman with four children; all attend school and are under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kafedha has operated a clothes selling business to sell to her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the changing climate. Kafedha dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

She wants to purchase a bale of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: René de 30 años, repara celulares y vende accesorios para estos desde hace 4 años. Su padre le hubo enseñado desde niño este negocio, y en el como hacer mantenimientos preventivos; paso a paso aprendió mucho de él,  pues se desempeña en esta misma actividad. Desde su puesto de ventas, Rene  ofrece muchos servicios que satisfacen a su clientela, que hoy es propia, a la que permanentemente ofrece variedades de accesorios, atendiendo que debe actualizarlo, para responder a su demanda.  Su horario de trabajo es desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde y entre su clientela se encuentran vecinos, amigos y referidos por estos.  Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia vivienda y ampliar su capital de trabajo, porque existe una gran competencia  que diariamente actualiza su oferta.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará carcasas, celulares y accesorios, para mantener un stock de inventarios, que impacten a sus compradores y vender mucho más.
texts.en:
René is 30, and repairs and sells cellular phones and accessories for the past 4 years. Since he was a child, his father taught him this business and how to do preventive maintenance.  Bit by bit, he learned a lot from him, and took up the same activity.

From a sales position, Rene offers many services that cater to the clientele which is now his own. He constantly provides varieties of accessories, attending to the demand.  His hours are from 8 am until 6 pm and his clients are friends and neighbors others referred by these.

His goal is to have his own house and to expand his working capital, because there is a great competition daily to realize sales. Currently, he has applied for a Kiva loan, primary financing from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy phones and accessories, to maintain a stock of inventories that will impress his buyers and enable him to sell more.

loans.use: will buy phone covers, phones and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
María, ve en los préstamos una opción para tener los implementos necesarios de manera rápida y así mantenerse trabajando, solicita capital para comprar concentrados (para ganado y aves de corral), abono, semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas, alimentara muy bien a sus animales y continuara cultivando granos básicos; otra parte lo utilizara para fortalecer la panadería de pan artesanal comprara huevos, harina, levadura, azúcar, sal, manteca, latas y leña.
Con el crédito anterior ha logrado mejorar su negocio, ya que aumento la productividad de su granja y mejoro la alimentación del ganado, la rentabilidad con que hoy cuenta le permite brindarle educación a sus hijos y una mejor alimentación. María ha invertido parte de las ganancias en la apertura de una panadería artesanal, con el fin de tener ingresos extras y resarcir las deudas.
texts.en:
Maria sees the loans as an option for having the supplies she needs in a rapid fashion, and that way she can continue working. She requests funding to buy feed (for livestock and poultry), manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides; she feeds her animals very well and she will continue growing staple grains. The other part will be used to improve her artesanal bread bakery. She will buy eggs, flour, yeast, sugar, salt, butter, tins, and firewood. 

With the previous loan she has been able to improve her business; she increased productivity of her farm and improved her animal feed. The profits from this now allow her to give an education to her children and to provide better food for them. Maria has invested part of her earnings into opening an artesanal bakery, with the goal of having extra income and paying off her debts.

loans.use: to buy feed (for livestock and poultry), manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, eggs, flour, yeast, sugar, salt, butter, tins, and firewood.

loans.name: Balvino

texts.es:
Balvino tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad tranquila que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, cerdos, desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Balvino is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in the District of Oyotún, a peaceful community that is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Balvino has been raising and selling animals such as roosters, young chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs for several years. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for fattening his animals. This will enable him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for fattening his animals.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan wants to thank all of the lenders who have contributed to pay for the treatment and medications for his daughter. Thanks to the support and help, she is feeling much better and Ramadan is very happy about her health and future. 

Because of the difficult times he has had and the lack of money, due to paying for his daughter's care, he has been living in very poor conditions. He requests a loan to renovate his house. This second loan will help to improve their living conditions.

He is very grateful to the lenders once again.

loans.use: to renovate the house.

loans.name: Yelsin Joel

texts.es:
Yelsin vive en Lima con su madre y hermana, su padre falleció cuando el era apenas un bebe por lo que es huérfano y tanto su crianza como manutención a estado a cargo de su madre prácticamente desde que nació. 
Su madre es comerciante, vino de Cerro de Pasco, provincia ubicada en la sierra peruana en busca de salir adelante en la capital y mantiene a su familia con los pocos ingresos que le genera su negocio de venta de abarrotes en su misma casa.
Ella no cuenta con los medios suficientes para poder seguir pagando los estudios del joven Yelsin, por lo que este tendrá que abandonar su carrera y comenzar a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Yelsin desea terminar su carrera y llegar a ser un gran profesional, ganar experiencia y llegar a administrar su propio negocio para poder ayudar a su madre y hermana. El sabe que este sueño solo sera posible de culminar sus estudios, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva de poder contar con su ayuda para cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Yelsin lives in Lima with his mother and sister; his father died when he was just a baby. His mother took charge of his growth and care since almost the day of his birth. His mother, a merchant, is from Cerro de Pasco, a province in the mountains. She came to the capital city looking for a way to get ahead and she takes care of her family with what little income her grocery store generates. She doesn't have enough money to continue paying for her son's schooling, which means Yelsin will have to abandon his studies and begin working if he doesn't have support from the Kiva lenders.

Yelsin wants to finish school and become a professional. He wants to gain experience and eventually run his own business so that he can help out his mother and sister. He knows that this dream will only be possible if he can finish his degree, which is why he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support in achieving his goals.

loans.use: to pay for technical studies in Industrial Management.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jairo es un emprendedor campesino y en sus venas corre la sangre de un guerrero pero al mismo tiempo de un hombre sensible ante su familia. Son sus 5 hijos la motivación diaria para levantarse e iniciar con sus labores diarias con empeño y fortaleza.
El tiene unos cultivos de frijol y albahaca, cultivos que atiende todos los días para obtener una buenas cosechas. Adicionalmente tiene ganado vacuno que compra y vende para obtener uno mejores recursos para su familia.
Es un hombre multifacético y con amplia experiencia en diferentes áreas de la agricultura.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas de frijol y habichuela, además de riegos y abonos para aplicarlos en sus tierras y poder garantizar unos buenos productos.
Sus cosechas las utiliza para la venta y para su propio consumo.
El crédito le dará la oportunidad de aumentar su patrimonio y tener la plena certeza de que su negocio seguirá en pie.
texts.en: Jairo is an enterprising farmer.  In his veins flows the blood of a warrior, but he is a sensitive man with his family.  His 5 children are his motivation for getting up every day to start his daily work with effort and strength.  He has bean and basil crops, which he tends every day to obtain better harvests.  He also buys and sells cattle to earn more income for his family.  He is a multifaceted man with broad experience in different areas of agriculture.  He is requesting a loan to buy bean seeds, as well as irrigation and manure to apply to his soil so as to guarantee good products.  He sells his products and also uses them for personal consumption.  The loan will give him an opportunity to expand his wealth and be certain that his business will continue to be on its feet.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a printing machine.

loans.name: Jocy

texts.en:
Jocy is 35 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Jocy works very hard to provide for them.

Jocy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. Jocy has been in this business for four years, and she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a supply of herbal products.

loans.name: Generation Vive Group

texts.fr:
Mr  ADAMA représente le groupe GENERATION VIVE. Marié, il est père de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école et il a 10 personnes à sa charge.
Mr fait l’agro pastoral depuis plus 40ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son village et marchés environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter 03 sacs d’engrais pour la semence et 02 moutons pour engrosser et revendre.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama represents the Génération Vive group. He is married and the father of four children. The oldest is ten years old and the youngest is two. One of them goes to school and he has ten dependents.

He has been involved in pastoral farming for over 40 years. He resupplies in his village and markets in the surrounding area.
 
He wants to buy three bags of fertilizer for the seeds and two sheep to fatten and resell. With his profits he wants to build a house.

loans.use: buy three bags of fertilizer for the seeds and two sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme LEONIE est la responsable du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle se porte bien. Sur la photo,elle n'a pas apporter ses marchandises donc présente celles d'une membre du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Mme veut s’acheter 06 sacs de mil, 03sacs d’haricot et 04sacs de maïs.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne  toujours s’acheter une moto et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Léonie represents the Renaissance group. She is doing well. In the photo, she did not bring her own goods so she is presenting those of a group member. 

She is the married mother of three children. The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is nine. All three go to school.

She has been selling grain for the past 11 years. She gets her supplies from surrounding villages. She wants to buy six bags of millet, three bags of beans and four bags of maize.

She wants to reinvest the profits in her business. Her ambition is still to buy a motorcycle and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy six bags of millet, three bags of beans and four bags of maize

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Chanthy is 46 years old and a mother of four children. One of her children still relies on her since he is in school. She overcomes her family’s hardship via farming one hectare each of rice and maize. This is the main source of income and her paid job. This business earns her about 35,600 KHR per day. This is the fourth cycle for Chanthy as a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completed payments of past loans, which have paved a way for her to improve her living conditions. Now, she leads a group of three members to request a loan of 3,000,000 KHR, of which each member will receive the same portion of 1,000,000 KHR. Chanthy will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to pay for plowing. As a hardworking farmer, she optimistically believes that through the help of the loan, she will be able to live in a better situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds and fertilizer and to pay for land plowing and labor fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand and open a poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 46 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, sugar, shampoo and other  groceries.

Ma. Delia has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Ma. Delia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, sugar, shampoo and other  groceries

loans.name: Carlos Ulises

texts.es:
Carlos, está acompañado y vive con su compañera de vida, sus hijos ya son independientes; se dedica a atender su taller mecánico de enderezado y pintura de automóviles, oficio que prendió desde hace ocho años y hace dos años realizo la apertura de su propio negocio, lo atiende con ayuda de dos empleados.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar bujías, adictivos, filtros, pinturas, entre otros materiales que necesita para realizar sus trabajos, espera brindar un buen servicio y tener buenas ganancias con las que piensa cancelar su deuda y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
Su visión es tener un negocio con mejor equipo, mantener sus clientes satisfechos, ahorrar para comprar un terreno y construir su casa propia.
texts.en: Carlos lives with his life partner, and his children are now independent.  He works in his mechanic shop repairing and painting cars.  He learned this trade eight years ago, and opened his own business two years ago, which he runs with the help of two employees.  He will use the loan to buy spark plugs, additives, filters, paint, and other materials that he needs to do his work.  He hopes to provide good service and have good earnings, with which he can pay his debts and improve his family's circumstances.  His vision is to have a business with better equipment, to keep his customers satisfied, to save to buy land and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, additives, filters, paint, and other materials.

loans.name: Tureme Group

texts.fr:
J. Marie fait partie du groupe Tureme et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 32 ans et est marie à Alice, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de  célibataire de 4  ans.

Il  a un studio, et fait le commerce de cassette audio et vidéo  depuis  5 ans. 

Il  est à son quatrième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter un appareil photo pour vendre le service de prise  des photos des clients ; il va aussi acheter des cassettes à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Marie is part of the Tureme group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 32 years old and is married to Alice, a shopkeeper. Together they have one four-year-old child. 

He has a studio and has been retailing audio and video cassettes for the past five years. 

This is his fourth credit loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy a camera to provide picture-taking services to his clients; he will also buy cassettes for resale, to earn more. 

In coming years he wants to buy a plot of land and see his children study.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a camera to provide a service taking clients' pictures. He will also buy cassettes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Gertrudis De Jesus

texts.es:
Gertrudis, logra una buena cosecha de sus cultivos con la ayuda del crédito anterior, sus ingresos se han mantenido, los cuales utiliza para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar y cancelar el préstamo.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para seguir fortaleciendo el negocio, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla, plaguicidas, gallinas indias, de esta manera cultivara granos básicos, también comprara aguacates para revender, aprovechando que es la temporada y así tendrá ingresos extras.
texts.en: Gertrudis has achieved a good harvest from her crops with the help of her previous loan.  Her earnings have supported her, as she uses them to pay for her basic household needs and repay the loan.  She is requesting another loan to continue strengthening her business.  She will invest it in manure, herbicides, seeds, pesticides, and Indian chickens.  With this she will grow basic grains, and will also buy avocados to resell, taking advantage of the season to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, seeds, pesticides,  Indian chickens and avocados.

loans.name: Ergin

texts.en: Ergin wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which he used to buy more plastic bags and increase his business. With the increase in income that he generated, he was able to provide proper living conditions for his family and he managed to expand his business even more. Needless to say, he was very satisfied with the loan results and is now asking once again for a second loan for the same purpose and business. He would like to purchase more plastic bags and hopes that he will again expand his business and continue to see improvement in his family’s living conditions. He really appreciates all of the help from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bags.

loans.name: Teang's Group

texts.en: Teang is a resident of the Phnom Preok district located in Battambang province. Teang is 49 years old and she is married with three children. She has two children living as dependents of her since they are still in school. In order to earn a living for the family, she engaged in agribusiness, farming rice and maize on four hectares of farmland, for about 17 years already. This is the fourth loan cycle for Teang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Teang repaid the past loan completely and it allowed her to uplift her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she and her joint borrower are applying for 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay labor fees. She hopes that in the near future, she will be able to earn a higher income to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Zulbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Zulbayar, 30 years old, lives with her parents and sister in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as a machinist at a power plant since 2006. Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house and saved lots of money on coal. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to run a grocery store. As a result, she will increase the family income, improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to run a grocery store

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma, renovara el inventario de la venta de ropa y para poder hacerlo de inmediato solicita capital para comprar faldas, vestidos, camisas, trajes, ropa interior para ambos sexos, se mantendrá compitiendo en el mercado, tendrá clientes satisfechos y seguirá teniendo los ingresos económicos para subsistir junto a su familia.
Con el préstamo anterior ofreció prendas con modelos nuevos a sus clientes y recupero lo invertido con ganancias que utilizo para pagar la deuda y hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Irma is increasing her inventory of clothing to sell.  To be able to do it immediately she is requesting a loan to buy skirts, dresses, shirts, suits, and underwear for both sexes.  She will be able to support herself competing in the market, to have satisfied customers and to continue earning income to support herself and her family.  With the previous loan she offered new styles of clothing to her customers and recovered the investment with earnings to repay her debt and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, shirts, suits, and underwear for both sexes.

loans.name: Eit's Group

texts.en:
Mongkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province is the home of Eit and her family. She is a 60-year-old married woman and also the mother of three children. Their primary source of income comes from rice cropping on three hectares of farmland, and Eit raises a cow as extra income. 

Eit has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles already. She has completed the repayments of her past loans and they have allowed her to improve her family situation. 

She leads a group of two members to request a loan of 600,000 KHR, of which she will have a portion of 200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes that she will get a higher yield so that she can increase the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en: Shpresa is the 31-year-old mother of six children between the ages of 2 and 11 years old. They all live in a small house with 12 members from her husband’s family. Shpresa is involved in agricultural work, where she purchases calves and raises them to sell later for money to earn a living. Her husband works as a butcher. At this time she is requesting a loan to renovate the stable and purchase another calf. However, she would like to buy this calf to be used only for her family needs, using the milk to feed her family and making other dairy products for them too. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have her own house for just her husband and children and will be able to also offer her children a better education so they will have a better future.

loans.use: to renovate the stable and purchase another calf

loans.name: Lucia Carolina

texts.es: Lucia tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 13 años, 7 años y un año de edad. Lucia se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva principalmente  mora, espinaca y cilantro. Por medio del cultivo de hortalizas es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Lucia desea dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a sus hijos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para sus hijos. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro.
texts.en: Lucia is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her three children, ages thirteen, seven, and one. Lucia works in agriculture; she mainly plants blackberries, spinach, and cilantro. By growing plants she is able to sustain her household. Lucia hopes to give better living conditions to her children and that is why she requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a fourth bedroom for them. With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron to build a fourth bedroom.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her spouse works as a fireman. To make up her spouse's income, she also manages a small store in their village selling grocery items to her neighbors. 

As she has insufficient funds to sustain her daughter's education, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to pay for the tuition fees. Her daughter, Mitzi Riva, is a freshman student doing a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy, and she wants to finish her education so that she can help her parents and become a successful woman someday.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Anass

texts.en:
After Anass finished the repayment of the installment of his first loan from Kiva lenders, he applied for a second youth loan of 70,000 YER to purchase a mobile phone for himself. His own phone is very old and doesn't work well. 

The first loan helped Anass very much to improve his family's standard of living. He thanks Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan, and he hopes to be financed again for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone for himself.

loans.name: Liljana

texts.en:
Liljana wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the last loan, which has helped her to expand her business. As this loan enabled her to purchase an inventory of toys for her shop, she has been able to satisfy her clients' demands for various types of toys, jewelry, pools for children etc. She is very satisfied with the income that she generates from her shop and her business is going very well, and this has allowed her to improve her living conditions. 

Now she is requesting another loan, but not for her toy store that she still runs, but for her home. Her furniture is very old and she is not able to replace it with just her salary. As a regular client, she promises to pay on time again and remain in good standing with KosInvest. 

She is very happy to have another opportunity and hopes for continued support.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for her house

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Mrs.Otgonjargal is 48 years old and lives in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She runs a carpentry shop in the basement of their apartment with her ​​husband. Her family works hard and has earned respect from their customers. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to renovate her apartment by buying necessary building materials such as vacuum windows and parquet flooring. The renovation will improve the efficiency of her apartment which is especially helpful for Mongolia's long and cold winters.

loans.use: to buy the necessary building materials to renovate her apartment

loans.name: Fiorela Angelica

texts.es:
Fiorela es una joven empresaria, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace 6 meses se dedica a la venta de perfumes, colocó un pequeño bazar en su domicilio para que pueda atender a los clientes. A pesar de ser muy joven tiene muchos planes de negocio que quiere ejecutarlos más adelante.
Fiorela está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para implementar el negocio y así pueda obtener más ganancias con lo cual ayudará a su familia y mejorará su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Fiorela, 19, is a young entrepreneur who is single and lives in Ica with her family.

She has been selling perfumes for six months now.  She set up a small bazaar in her home so that she can serve her customers.  

Although she is very young, she has a lot of business plans that she wants to fulfil in the future.

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she can buy more goods to improve her business and generate more income which will allow her to help her family and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, vive en una casa familiar con sus padres y dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, es madre soltera; por la necesidad de costear los gastos familiares ha instalado una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad y lácteos, ya tiene 5 años de estar funcionando su negocio, atiende en un horario de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, su dificultad es la competencia que tiene en la zona.
Invertirá en la compra de crema, quesos, quesillo, cuajada, aceite, pastas, arroz, frijoles, golosinas, pan, bebidas, etc., le ayudara a tener lo más surtido posible la tienda para ganar clientes nuevos y mantenerlos satisfechos, al comprar por mayoreo ahorrara y tendrá un buen margen de ganancias con las que cumplirá puntualmente su pago al crédito.
Anhela tener estabilidad económica que le permita comprar un freezer en el que conservara mejor los productos lácteos  y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in her family home with her parents and two children aged nine and two.  She is a single mother.  

As she needs to take care of the family expenses, she has set up a store in which she sells basic household goods and dairy products.  She has had this store for five years now.  She serves customers from six in the morning until seven in the evening.  The main challenge she faces is the competition in the area.

She will invest the loan in buying cream, cheeses, cuajada, oil, pasta, rice, beans, candy, bread, drinks, etc.  This will allow her to keep her store well-stocked so she can attract new customers and keep them satisfied.  By buying the goods wholesale, she will save money and have a good margin for making profit which will enable her to pay off her loan on time.

She dreams of having economic stability which will allow her to buy a freezer to conserve the dairy products better; and also to support her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries for her store.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for the business.

Geraldine has been in this business for 1 year and she earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for her seaweed business

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor, es soltero, vive únicamente con una sobrina, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero; dentro de su familia aprendió a trabajar en el campo cultivando maíz, su horario es de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, por el momento no representa dificultades.
Como se acerca el tiempo justo para sembrar, al no contar con los recursos económicos para adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios, solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, insecticidas y herbicidas. Espera tener una cosecha abundante para abastecer su hogar y comercializar el resto así tener ingresos para resarcir la deuda.
Su visión es tener estabilidad económica para comprar su casa propia y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Hector is single and lives only with a niece.  He doesn't receive any financial aid from abroad.  

He learned from his family how to work in the field growing maize.  He works from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon, which for the moment does not give him any difficulties.

As the time for sowing nears, he is asking for a loan to buy the necessary agricultural supplies because he hasn't got the resources to buy them himself.  He needs a loan to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides.  He hopes to have an abundant harvest which will allow him to feed his family and then sell the rest to generate an income and pay off the debt.

He hopes to gain financial stability in the future so he can buy his own home and continue working.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea, invirtió el préstamo anterior en productos de revista y ropa  para ofrecer otro tipo de mercadería a sus clientes, con lo que ha tenido resultados positivos en su negocio.
Ha decidido solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar analgésicos, reconstituyentes, vitaminas, laxantes, lociones, cremas corporales, cosméticos y variedad de ropa, para continuar con el negocio y mantener a sus clientes bien satisfechos.
texts.en:
Timotea invested her previous loan in products from magazines and clothes so she could offer a different type of merchandise to her customers.  This has given her success in her business.

She has decided to ask for a new loan to buy painkillers, tonics, vitamins, laxatives, lotions, body creams, cosmetics and a variety of clothing.  She hopes this will keep her business well-stocked and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy a variety of medicines and clothes for her store.

loans.name: Hodeliza

texts.en:
Hodeliza is 27 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase noodles, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Hodeliza has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns additional income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Generoso Manuel

texts.es:
La independencia y trabajo duro son dos cualidades que describen perfectamente a Generoso, un hombre que manifiesta una gran experiencia y gusto por obtener sus propios ingresos y ser responsable de su familia.
El es un agricultor que ha trabajado el campo durante toda su vida, pues desde que era un niño siempre estuvo rodeado de estas actividades.
Hoy en día es un hombre orgulloso de sus logros gracias a su constancia y dedicación.
El pide un auxilio económico para comprar insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y pesticidas, productos que podrá aplicar a sus cultivos de plátano y yuca en zona rural del municipio de Montería.
El préstamo le dará ese impulso que tanto aclama y necesita.
Su mayor desafío es el incesante clima que en muchas ocasiones lo obliga a detener sus actividades.
texts.en:
Generoso is a man who can best be described as hard-working and independent.  He is a man who has a lot of experience and he likes to be able to generate his own income and be the person responsible for taking care of his family.

He is a farmer and he has worked in the country all his life.  Since he was a child he has always been surrounded by agriculture.

Today, he can feel proud of his achievements thanks to the hard work and dedication he has put in.

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides and fertilizers; products he can use on his banana and yucca plantations which he has in Monteria.  The loan will give him the lift that he is desperate for.

His greatest challenge is the incessant climate, which obliges him to stop working from time to time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren, 32, is a villager from Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of four dependent children, three of whom are still in school. Ren struggles to make a living through rice farming and to supplement her income, she also works as a construction worker. 

This is the first loan for Ren and her co-borrower from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The total amount of the group is 2,000,000 KHR, as they have requested 1,000,000 KHR each. Ren is the leader of the group, and she will use the loan to buy rice seeds and to pay land plowing fees. She hopes that she can replant her paddy rice on time with a good yield in return.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and to pay land plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mirvete

texts.en:
Mirvete is very thankful to all of the lenders for her previous loan, which helped her to renovate her house, specifically, to purchase the building materials for the façade and insulation of her house. This improved the family conditions, for which she is thankful to all of the lenders for. This loan and the renovation, have allowed her family to live a normal and healthy life.

She is now requesting a loan for the second time, in order to change the engine of her husband’s wood cutting machine. Her husband's work provides the main source of income for their family and he generates his income by cutting wood, which he then sells in the local area. This second loan will help to generate more income and secure the financial situation of her family. She is very grateful and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To replace the engine of her husband’s wood cutting machine

loans.name: Laston

texts.en:
Laston is still growing his mobile money transacting business. He would like to thank all the lenders for their continued support and for the positive impact their loans have made on his business and daily life. The last loan increased his working capital, allowing him to make more transactions to more customers. He has also been able to send and receive larger amounts of money at his shop.

Laston is 45 years old and owns a Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lusaka city centre with his wife. They live in a rented house with their four children, two of his wife’s sisters and a 5-year-old niece. 

Laston likes to describe his business as the service of sending and receiving money from one location to another in Zambia. He started operating the business as a way of providing for his family and empowering his wife. Laston enjoys the business because it is an opportunity for him to serve his community. He enjoys interacting with all the customers from different walks of life that do business at his outlet.

Laston has requested a second loan so that he can increase his working capital float (this is the money that he uses to service his customers). This increase will mean that he will be able to serve more customers who need to send and receive money from his shop.

Laston’s dream is to take care of his family and educate his children. He would like his kids to have the education that he never had the opportunity to receive.

In this picture, Laston is sitting outside his mobile money transfer shop.

loans.use: To grow his mobile money transfer business by increasing the amount of money available to serve people in need of financial services

loans.name: Jinelda

texts.en:
Jinelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming seaweed in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like plastic rope, seedlings, etc. for her seaweed farming business. She has been in this business for 1 year, and also earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like plastic rope, seedlings, etc. for her seaweed farming business

loans.name: Jiguisseme B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  KAFANA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame SARAN débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME B. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0.5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jiguisseme B Group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the commune of Kafana, Sikasso district (third administrative region of Mali).

During the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses.  This will be their tenth group loan. The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Saran (standing second from the right in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy one 50kg sack of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide, and pay the labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, on a cash or credit basis.  Saran expects to make an average profit of 75,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which will enable her to repay her loan and help her husband to provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is 49 years old and she is happily married to Warlito. God has blessed them with four loving children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Milagros owns a variety store. This is a small store that is connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a tiny bit of cooking oil, or an egg among other things. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price then she sells it in smaller quantities at a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to offer more products for her store.

Milagros hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jiguisseme C Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  KAFANA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame  CHATA O assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME C. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0.75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jiguisseme C Group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the commune of Kafana in the Sikasso district (third administrative region of Mali).

During the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses.  This will be their tenth group loan.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Chata O (sitting second from the right in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy two 50kg sacks of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide and to pay labour costs to work three-quarters of a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.  Chata O expects to make an average profit of 85,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband to provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en: Yin is a resident from Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. Her main sources of income are from rainy season rice and her job at a construction site. She has farmed for 25 years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Yin is a second-time borrower and has repaid back her past loan completely. Now, her living conditions have improved since she had the last loan. Now, she leads a group of three to request a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, and rice seed for her farm. She believes that she will reap a large harvest as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Sina is 33 years old and married. She and her husband have two children and they earn a living through selling grocery items and working for others for a fee. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 70,000 KHR per day to support her family.
