This is Sina's second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is leading her group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more sales and to sell for a good price, so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Joesita

texts.en:
Joesita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business culturing seaweed in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional seaweed seedlings for her business culturing seaweed.

Joesita has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from fishing.

Joesita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  KAFANA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame  DJENEBA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0. 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jiguisseme 1 Group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the commune of Kafana, in the Sikasso district (third administrative region of Mali).

During the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses.  This will be their sixth group loan.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Djeneba (standing second from the left in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy one 50kg sack of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide, and pay labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.  Djeneba expects to make an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 40 years old, widowed and solely responsible for sending her children to school. She operates a small canteen and panciteria in their village. Her child, Gabriela Faye wanted to become a teacher someday. She had insufficient funds to sustain her child's education. Rosalinda is now asking for a loan of PHP 17,000. She will pay for the school fees (tuition) and allowance for her child in school. Her daughter has a strong determination to finish her studies and help her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to pay school fees (tuition) and allowance for her child in school

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marina works hard to support her family. She has a seaweed cultivating business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. 

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like plastic rope, empty containers, etc. for her seaweed cultivating business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy materials like plastic rope, empty containers, etc. for her seaweed cultivating business

loans.name: Yesu N'inyishu Group

texts.fr:
Céline  fait partie du groupe Yesu n’inyishu  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 32  ans et est marié à Laurent, un commerçant.

Elle  fait le commerce  de chaussures depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chaussures  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle  voudrait  construire une maison.
texts.en:
Céline is a member of the Yesu N'inyishu Group, and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 32 years old and married to Laurent, who is a retailer.

Céline has been selling shoes for ten years.  This will be her tenth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of shoes to sell.  She hopes that this will increase her income.

In the coming years, Céline would like to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy many shoes for resale.

loans.name: Dora Lucia

texts.es: Dora una orgullosa madre de 52 años la cual debido a su sentido de pertenencia y de responsabilidad abandono sus actividades de confección por el cuidado y la crianza de sus hijos puesto tenía un orden de prioridades y no quería que ningún trabaja le hiciera perder ni un segundo del crecimiento de sus hijos, ya con sus hijos en una edad más acorde reinicio su actividad con una pequeña maquina la cual con ayuda de ahorros y créditos fue creciendo hasta llegar al punto de tener horarios, clientes y personal definido pues a la señora Dora le colaboran dos vecinas cabeza de hogar, con ayuda de sus vecinas quiere hacer crecer su empresa acoger un mayor número de clientes y establecerse como una de las empresas más buscadas y recomendadas en el sector solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina cortadora y una maquina fileteadora con la que aspira a generar dos o tres empleos más para que juntas logren consolidar la empresa y sacar sus familias adelante
texts.en:
Dora, 52, is a proud mother who through a sense of duty and responsibility abandoned her sewing activity to raise her children who are her priority.  She did not want any job to get in her way of caring for her children.  When they gew older she resumed her work with a small machine, using her savings and a loan to grow enough to establish a schedule, customers and hire workers.  Dora has the help of two neighbors who are heads of household.  With their help she wants to grow her company and increase the number of customers and become one of the most sought out, recommended companies in the sector.

Dora is requesting a loan to buy a cutting machine and an overlock sewing machine so she can generate two or three more jobs to consolidate her business and help the families to prosper.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and a cutting machine so she can generate two or three jobs for her neighbors.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: After Mohammed finished the repayment of the installment of the first loan from Kiva lenders, he applied for a second youth loan of 70,000 YER from Kiva lenders in order to enlarge his business more by purchasing other amounts of phone accessories, compact discs, music players, phone chargers, and other items. He warmly thanks Kiva lenders for the first loan that helped him very much in enlarging and expanding his business. That loan helped him to change the living standards of his family. For further expansion, Mohammed applied for a second loan. He hopes to be financed for this loan.

loans.use: to buy music players and computer accessories, among other items that customers have ordered.

loans.name: Yuranis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yuranis es una joven emprendedora con hambre de progreso y con un corazón luchador que le permite superar todas las adversidades.
Es soltera y vive con sus padres que ya están avanzados en edad y ella responde por ellos.
Ella obtiene ingresos por medio de la venta de mercancía a través de catalogo que ofrece de manera ambulante, la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos cercanos y familiares. Adicional a esto trabaja en una droguería como empleada.
Ella tiene grandes sueños y desea cumplirlos todos, por ahora el más próximo es poder sacar su negocio adelante y darle un impulso inyectándole capital. Por esta razón es que solicita un crédito para comprar surtido de productos tales como ropa y productos de belleza, este surtido le brindara mucha más seguridad para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Yuranis is a young entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead and a fighting spirit which allow her to overcome all adversity.  She is single and lives with her parents who are elderly and in her care.

She earns a living selling products by catalogue which she sells door-to-door.  Most of her customers are close friends and relatives.  She also works in a hardware store as an employee.

Yuranis has great goals and wants to fulfill all of them.  The most immediate one is to give her business a boost by injecting capital.  Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products such as clothing and beauty products so she has a sense of more security to continue working.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Doña Vilma es una persona muy trabajadora, es viuda, Comerciante, sus cuatro hijos son mayores de edad y le ayudan en lo poco que pueden, ella busca como ganarse el pan de cada día y mantiene su hogar con su negocio de Pulperia, ya que no es suficiente para sus gastos la ayuda que recibe de sus hijos, pues desde que falleció su esposo le ha tocado hacerle frente a sus gastos sola y apoyada de las venta que realiza de productos pulperos como Gaseosas, Galletas, Chiveria en general, Jabón, Azúcar y otros productos de uso domestico.  Solicita este crédito para surtir su negocio y seguir trabajando y no depender de sus hijos ya que piensa en su vejez.
texts.en: Vilma is a hard-working widow who is a merchant.  She has four adult children who help her when they can.  She earns a living and maintains her household with the grocery store she has.  It is not enough to cover all her expenses, though, so her children help her out.  Ever since her husband passed away she has had to face expenses all alone and live off sales of products such as sodas, cookies, dairy products, soap, sugar and other domestic products.  She is requesting a loan to stock her store to continue working and not have to depend on her children in her old age.

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store such as juices, sodas, cookies and other items.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  KAFANA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame NIENIBA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0. 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Jiguisseme 2 Group are married women who are, on average, 29 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the commune of Kafana, Sikasso district (third administrative region of Mali).

During the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their agricultural businesses.  This will be their sixth group loan.  The previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Nieniba (sitting on the right in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy one 50kg sack of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide, and pay the labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.  Nieniba expects to make an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which will be used to repay her loan and help her husband to provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is married and has children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Jumwa operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Jumwa is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, bags, gas tanks and propane gas.

loans.name: Yony Yoel

texts.es:
Yony es un joven emprendedor, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en una prestigiosa empresa, desempeñando su labor con mucha responsabilidad y seriedad.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia.
Yony está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un equipo de sonido para que su familia pueda disfrutar de momentos agradables juntos, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Yony, 25, is a young entrepreneur who lives with his family.  For over a year he has been working at a prestigious company, carrying out his job with much responsibility and seriousness.  He is a person determined to get ahead and give his family a better future.  

Yony is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support he will be able to buy the sound equipment he wants for his family to enjoy good times together.  This will improve his quality of life so he can continue striving to meet his goals.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Amahoro Group

texts.fr:
Dévote fait partie du groupe Amahoro et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Assumani un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 4 à 15 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge  5 enfants, membre de sa famille élargie dont 3 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de  fruits(oranges, bananes mûres,avocats,...)  depuis  17ans. 

Elle est à son onzième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle   va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande  quantité  de fruits(oranges, bananes mûres,avocats,...) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Dévote is a member of the Amahoro Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 35 years old and married to Assumani who is a retailer.  Together they have seven children, aged between four and fifteen years old.  All their children attend school.  She is also responsible for a further five children, from within her extended family, three of these children attend school.

Dévote has been selling fruit (oranges, bananas, blackberries, avocados, etc) for seventeen years.  This will be her eleventh loan with the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of fruit (oranges, bananas, blackberries, avocados, etc) for resale.  In this way, she hopes to increase her revenue.

In the coming years, Dévote would like to buy a plot of land and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of fruit (oranges, bananas, blackberries, avocados, etc) for resale.

loans.name: Dorn's Group

texts.en:
Dorn, a mother of one child, is 33 years old and a villager from the Ponhea Krek district in Kampong Cham province. She supports her daily cost of living via cassava farming and rice farming. This business earns her about 38,400 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Dorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this loan cycle, she has teamed up in a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, Dorn will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop and to pay the plowing fee. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield that is better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jiguisseme F Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME F sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  KAFANA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame DJENEBA ABDOULAYE assise à la première de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME F. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0.75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

Djeneba Abdoulaye (sitting on the left in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy two 50kg sacks of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide, and pay the labour costs to work three-quarters of a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village, in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.  Djeneba Abdoulaye expects to make an average profit of 85,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which will be used to repay her loan and help her husband to provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay labour costs for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Dufatanye Acb Group

texts.en:
Dufatanye meaning "let's work together" is the name of the group led by Aliane. Aliane and her group members have been in their businesses for the past three years. All the group members sell different items in their businesses, but they all have the common goal to achieve a better future. 

With her portion of the loan, Aliane wishes to buy more cows to slaughter as she is running a butcher's shop. She expects to buy more cows from the profits that she will obtain from the business. All the group members are inspired by looking at their future as they are trying to change their lives, not like the way they were before, by making still more efforts for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more cows to provide meat for sale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 43 years old and the mother of two boys. She is living with her husband, her children and her husband’s parents in one of the minority communities in Kosovo. Both Svetlana and her husband are receiving a pension from the electric company that they used to work for in the past. 

After the war, the minority communities have experienced much damage and suffered economically, being unable to rebuild and thrive. The families, such as Svetlana’s, in these communities lost employment, homes and other valued things. Their house needs insulation and a balcony, so Svetlana is requesting a loan at this time. The loan will improve their living conditions and ensure a better environment. She is very thankful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as being strong in faith. For the past five years, Rael has operated a retail business where she sells charcoal. Her business is located in a nice place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as being the lack of funds. 

Rael will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Djoua

texts.fr: Marié a une couturière,Djoua est un jeune homme vaillant et amoureux de la terre. Il dispose d un lopin pour semer du mais et des sésames,très souvent Djoua a du mal a trouver de la main d œuvre pour ses récoltes.il prévoit moderniser son agriculture avec les revenus de son travail en achetant un tracteur.Djoua est papa d un enfant  et voudrait lui assurer un avenir certain avec le fruit de son travail.
texts.en:
Djoua is a brave young man who enjoys working with the soil.  He is married to a seamstress and has one child.

Djoua has a plot of land where he grows maize and sesame seeds.  Often he has difficulty finding workers to help with his harvesting, so he would like to modernise his systems and use his income to buy a tractor.

Djoua has one child and would like to use the rewards of his work to secure a good future for his child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sesame seeds for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Ernesto, her husband, works as a messenger. She manages a processed meat retail business, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditure. Aside from this, she also sells fruit shakes and peanut brittle as her additional source of income. 

*Imelda appears in the photo with her shake business.

What Imelda basically does is buy processed meat products from wholesalers, and she sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from ham, hot dogs, processed pork to other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options that she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Imelda is taking out a PHP 8,000 loan to purchase more quantity and variety of frozen products to expand her product inventory.

In the future, she hopes to get more customers, and she dreams of good health for her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantity and variety of frozen products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sekela

texts.en:
Sekela, aged 31, prides herself on being hard-working. She is the mother of two young children, aged four and one year and four months. She has continued to grow her Zoona mobile money transfer business by opening another outlet in her home town of Chipata. Sekela enjoys her business because it helps her to provide for her growing family.

Sekela received her first Kiva loan in February. The loan helped her business by increasing the amount of money that she uses to service customers. This helped her grow her business because she was able to provide a quicker and better service to her customers. The loan also helped her to open another outlet. In addition, she has employed three young people to help her run her two shops.

Sekela is requesting her second loan in order to boost the working capital at her newly opened outlet. She explains that having sufficient money to serve customers is very important for her business as it helps to build trust with her customers.

Sekela is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their continued support. She would like to let them know that she has enrolled her oldest child in a school.

loans.use: To boost her working capital at her new Zoona mobile money outlet to satisfy customers who need to send and receive money

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira lives in Arshaluys village in the Armavir region. She lives with her son as her husband and mother-in-law have currently migrated to Russia. Elmira, as she used to do, is engaged in agriculture and cultivates various vegetables and fruits. She cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers and some greens. She also has apple and peach trees and several plum and pear trees. Elmira sells her garden’s harvest through the re-sellers or at the wholesale market.

This will be Elmira's first loan from Kiva. The loan will support her in renovating her greenhouse and being able to continue her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has had a seaweed cultivating business in the Philippines for the past eight years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings for her seaweed cultivating business.

Sonia dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase little chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself as optimistic. For the past three years, Pauline has operated a retail business where she sells charcoal. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge as being the lack of funds. 

Pauline will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have frequent cash flow and a good lifestyle. Pauline will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and to save.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Bethlehem Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Marie est une Couturière, vendeuse des matériels de couture dans le marché central de la ville depuis 11 ans, vice présidente, membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Bethlehem» âgée de 43 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont 7 étudient et 2 sont encore gamins. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter des nouveaux matériels de couture (ciseaux, rouleaux tissus et fil). Elle avait reçu son premier fonds par le truchement de son mari. Son conjoint est un pharmacien. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un atelier, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du systeme bancaire classique, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Marie is a seamstress and has been selling sewing materials in the central market for eleven years.  She is a member and vice-president of the business group 'Bethlehem'.  Marie is 43 years old, married and mother to nine children.  Seven of her children attend school but the other two are still too young.

Marie has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  This new loan will enable her to buy new sewing materials (scissors, rolls of fabric and thread).  Marie's husband is a pharmacist, and he provided the initial funds for her to start her business.

In the future, Marie would like to build a workshop, and feed and educate her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system, by granting them unsecured loans.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and supplies (scissors, rolls of fabric and thread) for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Voctoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Voctoria works hard to support her family. She has a seaweed cultivating business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. 

Voctoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy seedlings, plastic rope, etc. for her seaweed cultivating business.

Voctoria hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, plastic rope, etc. for her seaweed cultivating business

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bassirou, âgé de 59 ans, s’active dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. Il est marié et père de famille. Son commerce consiste à vendre des tissus de diverses variétés. Tissus qu’il se procure en Gambie ou dans le marché local même. Monsieur Bassirou est à son 3ème crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des tissus à la mode destiné à la commercialisation. 
Bassirou s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et veille à améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires. Il rêve de développer son commerce jusqu’à devenir un grand commerçant détenant un grand magasin de vente de tissus tout genre.
texts.en: 59-year-old Bassirou has worked in business for several years. He is a married family man. His business consists of selling a wide variety of fabrics, which he procures from Gambia or even his local market. This will be Bassirou's third loan, which will allow him to purchase fashionable fabrics and then resell them. Bassirou sees to his family's daily expenses and wishes to improve their dietary conditions. He dreams of developing his business into a large enterprise where he has his own shop, in which he sells all sorts of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics which he can resell

loans.name: Dutsimbatare Group

texts.fr:
Savere fait partie du groupe Dutsimbatare  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 30  ans et est mariée à Etienne, une  commerçante.
Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot riz,…) depuis 10 ans.

Elle est à son seizième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Savere belongs to the Dutsimbatare group and lives in Gitega. She is 30 years old and married to Etienne, who is a trader. She has been running a small shop busines (beans, rice,..) for the past ten years and is on her 16th loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans to resell, so that she can earn more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans to resell, so that she can make more money.

loans.name: Aboudouraoufou

texts.fr: Aboudouraoufou est originaire de la région centrale.Age de 30 ans, il  est célibataire sans enfants.Tres  vite ,il a pris sa vie en main et aujourd’hui  il est revendeur de vêtements et de chaussures.Aboudouraoufou a souvent du mal pour s approvisionner et passer de vrai  commande digne de ce nom dans son commerce,et pour s approvisionner pour une première fois,il sollicite un premier prêt de 500000FCFA pour y arriver, Il remercie des lors tous les préteurs de kivq qui croiront en son commerce.
texts.en: Aboudouraoufou originates from the central region and he is 30 years old and single with no children. He took charge of his life at an early age and today he sells clothes and shoes. He often has difficulty in getting supplies and to make worthwhile orders in his business. So he is requesting a first loan of 500,000FCFA so that he can get fresh supplies for the first time. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for believing in his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is a married woman who has three children. For the past seven years, she has operated a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in a nice area and her primary customers are women. Carren describes her biggest business challenge as being the lack of funds. 

Carren will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be good in business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Battur, aged 53, lives with his wife and daughter in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. Eight months ago, he began to work as a sentry at a private firm. His wife has a job as an operator at a sewing factory. They have four children, the elder three of whom live on their own. The youngest daughter studies at college. 

Battur is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors for their house renovation. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and therefore less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, aged 53, is a single mother of three adult children who are aged between 18 and 22. She has been operating a tailoring business and selling new clothes as well as knitting for the past 17 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.                           
	
Grace has applied for her third loan of KES 27,000 with VisionFund Kenya, to buy fabric materials, new clothes and knitting threads for her business. She plans to use the anticipated income to expand her business and provide for her family's basic needs.
	
Grace hopes to have a bright future and to be financially stable

loans.use: to buy more stock of fabric materials, new clothes and knitting threads

loans.name: Zoila De Jesus

texts.es:
Zoila, solicita más capital para comprar aceite, azúcar, jabón, golosinas, pan, café, arroz, condimentos, especias, bebidas, etc., para surtir la tienda y mantener la preferencia de sus clientes, el resto será utilizado para hacer remodelaciones en su vivienda comprara cerámica, sementó, hierro, arena  y pago de mano de obra, le servirán para afinar paredes y cambiar el tipo de piso.
Con el préstamo anterior remodelo parte de su vivienda y ha mantenido su negocio surtido, con lo que ha mejorado las ganancias las cuales utiliza cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Zoila is requesting a loan to buy vegetable oil, sugar, soap, candies, bread, coffee, rice, spices, beverages, etc. She wants to increase her stock levels and keep her customers’ loyalty. With the remaining money she will make some home improvements. She will buy floor tiles, cement, iron bars and sand, and pay for the labor. With this, she will plaster the walls and change the floor.

With the previous loan she remodeled her house and kept her stock in good shape. This has resulted in more profits, which she uses to cover her family’s needs and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store, such as vegetable oil, sugar, soap, bread and coffee.

loans.name: Jennifer Estephany

texts.es:
Jennifer, utilizo el financiamiento anterior para comprar materia prima para la venta de tortillas, su impacto ha sido positivo ya que aumento la productividad, con los nuevos ingresos cancelo con buen record crediticio su préstamo, las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y ya cuenta con una pequeña tienda.
Para continuar prosperando opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, leña, gas propano, arroz, aceite, jabón y bebidas. Continuara con la venta de tortillas y surtirá el inventario de la tienda.
texts.en:
Jennifer used the previous loan to buy ingredients for her tortilla business. It had a positive impact on her productivity. With the additional profits she was able to pay off the loan according to plan. Her family’s living conditions have improved and she has now a small store.

She is requesting a new loan in order to continue progressing. She will buy corn, firewood, propane, rice, vegetable oil, soap and beverages. She will continue selling tortillas and will buy supplies for her store.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, propane, rice, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is involved in agriculture. She breeds livestock (cows and calves, pigs and piglets, and chickens) and cultivates wheat, corn, potatoes and garlic. Anahit lives with her husband, 23-year-old son and parents-in-law. Her son is a cook working in the army. 

Anahit sells the agricultural products (milk, meat, cheese) in nearby markets and earns income for her family's living expenses. Now, to improve her farm, she is requesting this loan of USD 2,500. She will use the loan to purchase seed potatoes, fertilizer and two piglets. Please support Anahit and her family to develop their farm further.

loans.use: to pay for seed potatoes, fertilizer and two piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Santos Ilario

texts.es:
Santos es una persona de 63 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la prestación de servicios de trasporte con un vehículo que es de su propiedad, se creció con sus abuelos ellos se dedicaban a la agricultura y dedicaron toda su vida a realizar esta actividad.

De esta manera Santos adquirió conocimiento y experiencia de sus abuelos quienes le inculcaron buenos valores y principios que son los que lo han llevado a continuar desempeñando esta actividad que por años se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, la que le ha servido para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y de esta forma pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y les pudo dar todo lo necesario, ahora ellos son unas personas de bien y de trabajo y de servicio para la comunidad. 

Él tiene una experiencia de 46 años realizando trabajos en la agricultura y prestación de servicio de trasporte, ha dedicado toda la vida,  ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, actividad que aprendió de sus abuelos quienes se sentían orgullosos de cultivar la tierra día a día, y él era quien los acompañaba todos los días a las parcelas de cultivos,  llevando una Cuma, un azadón y una calabaza con agua siendo estos sus implemento de trabajo.

El decidió dedicarse a este trabajo motivado por sus abuelos, y por las ganancias económicas  


El dinero será utilizado realizar reparaciones en el techo de su casa, ya que una parte ha cumplido con su vida útil y por encontrarnos en la época de invierno es necesario realizar estas reparaciones para asegurar el descanso y seguridad de su familia.

Las proyecciones que tiene son las de apoyar  los estudios a sus nietos, ya que manifiesta que uno ellos manifiesta que quiere estudiar gastronomía.
texts.en:
Santos is a 63 year old person. He works as a farmer and offers transportation services in the vehicle he owns. He was raised with his grandparents. They worked in farming and spent their whole lives doing this activity.

In this way, Santos acquired knowledge and experience from his grandparents, who instilled good values and principles in him. They have led to him continuing to do this activity that for years has been his main source of income. This has served to bring home the daily support for his family and in this way get his children ahead. He was able to give them everything they needed. Now they are good people and work and serve their community.   

He has 46 years' experience doing farm work and providing transportation service. He has done this his whole life, since it has become his main source of income and he learned this activity from his grandparents who were proud to work the land day to day. He would accompany them every day to their cropland, carrying a machete, a hoe and a gourd full of water as his work tools. He decided to do this work because of his grandparents and to earn income. 

The money will be used to make repairs in the roof of his house. A part of it has finished his useful life and since it is the rainy season it is necessary to do the repairs to endure the rest and safety of his family.

The plans he has are to help his grandchildren go to school, and he says one of them wants to study gastronomy.

loans.use: to do repairs on the roof of his house, because a part of it has finished its useful life and since it is the rainy season, these repairs have to be made.

loans.name: Francisca Del Rocio

texts.es:
Francisca del Rocío tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su mamá en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, por las mañanas alquila una mototaxi permitiéndole brindar servicio de movilidad escolar a los niños que estudian en el colegio de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca del Rocío is 29 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in the district of Cayaltí, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

She works raising and selling pigs. In the morning she rents a motorcycle taxi, allowing her to offer a school transportation service to children who go to the school in her district.  

She has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy small animals to fatten them up and offer them at a better price, generating better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten them up and offer them at a better price.

loans.name: Santos Cristino

texts.es:
Santos es una persona de 54 años de edad,  se dedica a la agricultura y cuido de ganado en su propiedad, se creció con sus abuelos ellos se dedicaban a la agricultura  trabajaron, la que les permitió llevar el sustento diario a su familia y cubrir con las necesidades básicas, Santos adquirió experiencia en el cuido de ganado ya que sus abuelos dedicaron parte de su vida a realizar esta actividad. 


Él tiene una experiencia de 36 se ha dedicado al trabajo independiente, ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar solo y ser su propio dueño de su tiempo y de su dinero. Gracias a su trabajo de cuido de ganado en sus propiedades  y con la ayuda de su esposa han dado lo mejor a sus hijos.


El dinero será utilizado para comprar ganado a un precio económico, luego se someterá a desparasitar y vitaminar para posteriormente ser puesto a la venta a un mejor precio, el cual le generara una ganancia que la dará un mayor impulso a su capital de trabajo y mejorara sus condiciones de vida. 


Los planes a futuro son los de un corral con ganado lechero y de doble propósito apoyar los estudios de sus hijos, y hacer mejoras en su casa de manera que le brinde protección y seguridad a su familia, todo esto lo podrá lograr con la buena inversión de sus ganancias, y un nuevo financiamiento que le permita realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Santos is 54 years old. He works as a farmer and he cares for cattle on his property. He was raised with his grandparents and they worked in farming. This allowed them to support their family and cover the basic needs. Santos acquired experience caring for cattle since his grandparents spent part of their lives doing this activity. 

He has 36 years experience working independently and he has always like to work and be in charge of his own time and money. Thanks to his work caring for cattle on his property and with his wife's help, he has given the best to his children. 

The money will be used to buy cattle at a good price and them treat them for parasite and give them vitamins. Later he will put them up for sale at a better price, which will generate profit and drive his working capital more and improve his living conditions.  

His plans for the future are to have a dairy cattle corral and also help his children with their education, as well as do some home improvement so he can better protect and secure his family. All of this will be possible with the good investment of his profits and a new loan that will allow him to make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy cattle at a good price to then treat them for parasites and give them vitamins to later sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small pigs to fatten them up and sell them at a higher price.

loans.name: Daariimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dariimaa is 55 years old and  lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She lives in a house on a plot of own land and has been engaged in cattle breeding with her husband for 31 years. 

She is requesting 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to amend the house and repair the roof and make needed exterior and interior repairs. If her family does the home renovation thanks to you, dear lenders, they will always feel the comfort and convenience that they need.

loans.use: to buy building materials needed to repair the roof and amend the house

loans.name: Amygail

texts.en:
Amygail has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than three years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her two children. The couple has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Amygail would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Amygail hopes to have a bigger storehouse for her business. She also desires good health and a better life for her family.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells liquid soap. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy to buy more raw materials for making liquid soap. Her major challenge includes transportation and thieves. Her goal and aspiration is to see her business grow into a big factory for making liquid soap and also to become a wholesaler. 

Sauda resides in a rented house where the family has no access to electricity but does have piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making liquid soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products for use in the salon

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 49 years old, married and has two children who are in school.  

Avelina and her family  survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Avelina is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Phillipines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Avelina has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her food vending.

With your help, Avelina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is thirty-four years old and married. She has three children who are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her selling of ready-to-wear apparel business.

With your help, Gemma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora is 53 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Pastora works very hard to provide for them.

Pastora's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Pastora has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Pastora has taken a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Pastora is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: The first loan helped Mohammed very much in improving and enlarging his business. Mohammed didn't yet complete the repayment of the installments of the first loan. But he thanks Kiva lenders very much for their first loan. Because of coming the holy month (Ramadhan), Mohammed's grocery needs a lot of goods and foods to face the different demands of people in this month. In this month, people purchase the foods in large amounts. For this reason, Mohammed has applied for a concurrent loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from Kiva lenders to purchase more goods and foods for his grocery. He hopes to be financed in this loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en: Rodella is married with 3 children. She is 43 years old and lives in Tapican, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She grows some pigs to earn a living and has had this business continuously for 1 year. Each month, she earns about 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 12,000  PHP for additional capital. Rodella has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: purchase additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Ninoy

texts.en:
Ninoy is 28 years old and married but they don't have a child yet. As sources of income, his spouse is a hog raiser who sells hogs once grown, while Ninoy is a tricycle driver offering transport services to the people in his village.

In order to keep his business profitable, he needs additional capital of PHP6,000 to pay for gasoline and maintenance for the motorcycle. His income will be saved and revolve with his wife's hog raising business, and someday they will achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for gasoline and maintenance for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is married with 2 children. She is 41 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Eliza operates her store to earn a living, and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns about 15,000 PHP doing this type of small business. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP for additional capital. Eliza has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodity items to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is married with 5 children. She is 56 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. She is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides. Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa is 58 years old, married and had nine children. Tomasa is a hog raiser and sells hogs when they reach their desired weight. She also engaged in a sari-sari (variety store) business but she decided to stop it because of the opportunity of a better income in the hog raising business. For this, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. It will help nourish the hogs for healthier growth. She hopes to keep maintaining the good flow of her business and someday achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
For more than five years, Ruby has operated a service-based business while her husband earns from employment as a security guard. Her business runs smoothly enough that she had successfully repaid her previous loan used for motor accessories and maintenance. To make the services safer, she took a new loan recently to cover additional maintenance for her motorcycle.

She plans to improve the service that she offers to add customers who could give more income to her business.

loans.use: to cover additional maintenance for her motorcycle

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald is a 34-year-old man who is married and a father to four children aged between 5 years and 9 months. He offers motorcycle-transport services, but also has a secondary business in horticultural farming. From the two businesses, he is able to make a profit of about 7,000 Kenya shillings, which is enough for his family's needs.

He just joined VisionFund Kenya, and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to expand his horticultural activities by adding more greenhouse materials and paying for the labor. He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve his family's living standards.

In the future, he would like to grow his business so that he can carry out his duties as a father and husband well.

loans.use: to expand his horticultural business by adding more greenhouse materials and paying for labor

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle has been growing crops of different varieties for more than four years. Through this, she makes a monthly income for the family that sustains its needs. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for farm preparation. Her farm is doing well but her income goes to their daily expenditures. She needs to improve the farm, so she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She hopes to expand her agricultural business and make the best production possible.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna helps her husband grow coconuts and bananas to sell. She has been doing this for eight years and earns well. She was also able to repay her previous loan successfully. Her farm needs fertilization in order to produce more coconuts and bananas. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail shop where he sells bread, cakes, sugar, drinks and other household goods. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers purchase items daily. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more bread, cakes, sugar, salt and other items. His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a business that sustains his family's needs. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more bread, cakes, sugar, salt and other items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Jocelyn will be able to repair and renovate her family home so as to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and has three children. Evangeline is single and has three children who are in school.

Evangeline and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Evangeline is taking out a housing loan amounting to 6,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Evangeline has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through selling ready-to-wear clothing.

With your help, Evangeline can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. On November 8 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a housing loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Felisa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is forty years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Gina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Gina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, 54, lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, and he is married with eight children. The family’s main sources of income are farming rice and fishing. Sokha has been in these businesses for 15 years.

He has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped him relieve the family's burden and improve their outlook. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland. He will use a portion of it to buy fishing materials. With this loan, Sokha hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and fees for her kids.

Luvuno operates a vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en:
Ma. Helen is forty-nine years old and married with two children, one of whom in school. Ma. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Helen's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Helen has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ma. Helen has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Helen is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Baye

texts.fr:
Baye est un jeune de 33 ans qui vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit à l’IMCEC. Baye est enseignant depuis 4 ans maintenant. Il sert dans un petit village situé à des kilomètres de la ville principale et fait le déplacement chaque jour pour aller dispenser les cours. Il loge chez ses parents et donne une participation mensuelle pour la dépense quotidienne de la famille. 
Baye est célibataire mais va changer de statut car ce crédit est destiné à régler des frais de son mariage. Il pourra fonder un foyer et avoir des enfants qui peut être dans 20 ans dans l’avenir pourront le relever de ses charges.
texts.en:
Baye, age 33, is a young man who is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, IMCEC. He's been a teacher for four years now. He works in a small village, located many kilometers from the main city, and travels every day to deliver his courses.

He lives at his parent's home and gives a monthly monetary contribution to help cover the family's daily expenses. Baye is single, but his marital status will change since this loan is meant to cover the expenses of his wedding.

He will be able to establish a family and have children who, 20 years in the future, may relieve him for his duties.

loans.use: to cover his wedding's expenses

loans.name: Ndeury

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndeury, un homme de 51 ans s’active dans le domaine de l’agriculture depuis plus de 15 ans. Il a hérité de champs qu’il exploite chaque année avec ses frères et ses enfants. 
Ndeury n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC, et celui-ci lui permettra d’acheter des semences et de l’engrais pour préparer la saison des pluies. Il a prévu de cultiver du mil, de l’arachide et du maïs. 
Ndeury est marié et père de 6 enfants qu’il a la charge de nourrir et cela il peut le faire grâce à ses revenus mais aussi grâce à sa femme qui fait du petit commerce et qui l’appui dans les charges familiales. 
Ndeury souhaite faire de l’embouche bovine pour améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndeury, age 51, has been a farmer for more than fifteen years. He inherited fields that he exploits every year with his brothers and his children.

This is his first loan from Kiva's partner, IMCEC. It will enable him to buy seeds and fertilizers to prepare for the rainy season. He intends to grow millet, peanuts, and corn.

Mr. Ndeury is married and the father of six children, who he has to feed. He manages to do it thanks to his income, but also to his wife, who is a retailer and helps him cover the family's expenses.

Mr. Ndeury wishes to fatten cattle in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 39 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He has a transportation services business.

Richard provides transportation services in his community, and he earns well from this. He has been running this business for ten long years. 
  
Richard is requesting this loan from GDMPC to cover vehicle maintenance costs.  In the future, he wants to give his own family a comfortable and a better future.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Miguel Angel Jose

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Tiene 2 hijos por quienes lucha constantemente para poder brindarles una buena educación y un excelente futuro.
Desde hace más de 3 años trabaja en un taller de mecánica y le va muy bien porque ha aprendido rápido el oficio y porque es una persona responsable y dedicada a su labor.
Miguel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un electrodoméstico (refrigeradora) para su vivienda,para que de esta manera sus productos puedan conservarse por más tiempo, mejorando así su calidad de vida y brindando bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a young entrepreneur with much desire to get ahead. He is single and lives with his family in Ica. He has two children for whom he struggles constantly so as to be able to provide them with a good education and an excellent future. For the past 3 years he has been working in a car repair shop. Things are going well for him as he has learned the work quickly and since he is a responsible and dedicated to his work.

Miguel is thankful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they provide he can buy an appliance (a refrigerator) for his house. In this way he can conserve his products longer, improving his quality of living and providing well-being to his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Silpa

texts.en: Silpa is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail shop where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to own a big store within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a retail business where he supplies bread to shops. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more bread to sell. His business goal is to be a major supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to sustain his family's needs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Nanchoc, una zona rural donde la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, patos, cerdos, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismo que le permitirán tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives with his family in the district of Nanchoc, a rural area where people work in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry. Located in the province of San Miguel, it belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountain ranges of Peru.
Edilberto raises animals such as cocks, poultry, hens, ducks, and pigs in order to sell them. He has been engaged in this activity for some years and carries it out at the back of his house. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 new soles in order to buy balanced feed to fatten said animals. His goal is to sell better animals to his customers.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten small barnyard animals.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is sixty-five years old and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Susana and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Susana is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Susana has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Susana can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en: Tehmine lives in Lusakert village in the Shirak region of Armenia with her husband, mother-in-law and two sons. Tehmine and her husband run a farm, where they raise cows and pigs along with cultivating wheat and potato. Tehmine does not have enough land to cultivate forage for the livestock, so she has to purchase forage, for which she needs sufficient funds. Tehmine has applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer and forage. Tehmine dreams of developing her farm so that her sons will be able to get involved in agriculture and earn enough income to sustain their families in the future.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer and forage

loans.name: Kley's Group

texts.en:
Kley is aged 41 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she has five children. To make a living, she has been in cassava planting for twenty years earning about 44,000 KHR per day. 
Kley has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid her previous loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Bunnary's Group

texts.en:
Living in the rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Bunnary is 54 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items in the village. She has been in this business for 30 years.
Bunnary has just joined VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy grocery items to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sek's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of three children, Sek is aged 62 and living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support her family, she farms rice as the main source of the family’s income and she has been in this business for thirty-one years. The current business earns about 40,000 KHR per day. 
Sek is in her eighth cycle with VisionFund. She completely repaid the other loans, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sek wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Kimchut's Group

texts.en:
From a rural village in the Sangke district of Cambodia, Kimchut is aged 31 years and single. She is a hardworking farmer who makes a living through raising pigs and chicken. Through this business she earns about 50,000KHR per day. 

Kimchut has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for seven loan cycles and successfully paid back her past loans with them. The loans have helped her family by relieving the family’s business expenses. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Kimchut wants to use her portion to buy piglets and pig feeds. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feeds.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Babacar, âgé de 41 ans, est tailleur de profession. Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine. Il possède un petit atelier où il exerce son activité de couture et confectionne des ensembles pour exposer et vendre. Il a besoin d’un crédit de 150 000F CFA pour acheter des tissus et garnitures dont il a besoin pour exécuter ce travail. Si la matière première est disponible, Babacar peut confectionner 3 à 4 ensembles par jour et ces derniers peuvent être vendus entre 13 000 francs et 15 000F l’ensemble.
Marié et père de famille, Babacar peut donc s’occuper de sa famille grâce aux revenus de son activité. Le crédit a un impact positif sur son activité, puisqu’il peut diversifier ses produits et services et élargir le nombre de ses employés. 
Son plus souhait serait de pouvoir agrandir son espace commerciale, augmenter le nombre de ses machines et disposer d’une boutique de vente de tissus tout genre.
texts.en:
Babacar is 41 years old and has worked as a tailor for five years. He owns a small workshop where he makes clothing to sell. 

He needs a loan of 150,000 francs CFA to buy fabrics and trim so that he can conduct his business. If the materials are available, Babacar can make three to four outfits each day, which he can sell for between 13,000 and 15,000 francs each.

Married and a father of a family, Babacar can takes care of his family with this business.

A loan will have a positive impact on his business by allowing him to diversify his products and services and to increase his number of employees.

His greatest wish is to be able to expand his workshop, increase his number of machines, and have a shop that sells all kinds of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabric and trim

loans.name: Turashoboye Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne  fait partie du groupe Turashoboye  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 47  ans et est mariée à Françoise, une commerçante.

Elle fait le commerce de bière industrielle et de limonade   depuis  20 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière et de limonade  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle  voudrait  achever une maison en cours de construction et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Turashoboye group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 47 years old and is married to Françoise, a merchant. 

Jeanne has been selling beer and lemonade for 20 years. This is her first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy many cases of beer and lemonade, which she will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to complete a house that is under construction and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer and lemonade

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Las Hijas de Dios es el nombre que escogieron las 9 socias del grupo. Un nombre con el que se identifican, y se sienten muy orgullosas de haberlo adoptado. Tienen muy claro las Reglas de Oro, y están muy convencidas que este grupo  cumple con los principios de un Banco Mujer ya que todas tienen los mismos objetivos, además comparten sueños y metas. Ellas van a invertir el crédito en actividades comerciales y agropecuarias. 
La líder del grupo es Doña Maríanela, nicaragüense con más de 20 años de vivir en Costa Rica, vive con su compañero y sus 3 hijos, todos estudiantes, 1 en primaria y 2 en secundaria. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se ha esforzado por salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Comerciante con mucha experiencia, vende ropa, perfumes, y productos de catalogo. El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería, para poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes y que hasta ahora por falta de dinero no la ha podido hacer, eso le va a permitir ampliar su cartera de clientes así como aumentar sus ingresos por ventas. Doña Marianela con mucho entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar sabe que el crédito es de mucha ayuda para ella y su familia, ya que le va a permitir acercarse a cumplir sus sueños, que son ver a sus hijos concluir sus estudios y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
"Banco Mujer Las Hijas de Dios" is the name that the 9 members of the group chose for their group. They identify with the name and feel proud to have adopted it. They keep the Golden Rule in mind and they are convinced that their group conforms to the principles of a Woman's Bank as they all have the same objectives as well as sharing dreams and goals. They will invest the loan in commercial and farming activities.

The leader of the group is Maríanela, a native of Nicaragua who has been living in Costa Rica for more than 20 years. She lives with her partner and her 3 children.
