The residents have taken advantage and have built pools and hotel complexes where thousands of domestic and international tourists visit every year. The area has beatiful landscapes and paradise-like areas and the residents are warm, with kind and gentle hearts. 

Hila, 54 years old, is married and her marriage has been blessed with 3 grown children who are married and live independently. Her husband is a driver and works driving a taxi. The house that they live in is their own. Hilda works selling lunches and attending people in her bar where she sells fast food. She has been doing this for the last 10 years. She works 6 days a week in her bar and also raises pigs and chickens. Her loan is for the purchase of a refrigerator and her goal is to  get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia vive en concubinato, tiene 3 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Lucia sobrevive vendiendo comida (rellenos de papa, arroz y yuca) Lucia quiere ampliar sus ventas por lo que necesita un prestamo para comprar insumos (papa, arroz y yuca) en mayor cantidad Lucia es apoyada por su pareja pero lo que ambos ganan no es suficiente por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Lucia lives with her common-law husband and has three children. She lives in La Paz in a rented brick and cement house. Lucia survives by selling food (dough stuffed with potatoes, rice, and yucca). 

Lucia wants to increase her sales and needs a loan to buy supplies (potatoes, rice, and yucca) in larger quantities. Her partner supports her, but their combined earnings are not enough and that is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy supplies (potatoes, rice, and yucca) for her food business.

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es:
La Señora. María desde hace dos años forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Gaviotas, grupo en el cual se siente como si estuviera en familia, ya que siempre se apoyan y tratan de salir en adelante. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Baños en Cuenca, parroquia que es la atracción debido a sus aguas termales, que han sido aprovechadas para la construcción de piscinas y centros hoteleros a los que acuden miles de turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Tiene bellos paisajes y lugares paradisíacos, su gente es cálida y de un corazón amable y gentil.
La Señora. María tiene 42 años de edad, está separada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, dos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan.
La Señora. María se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos y cuyes, también se dedica a tejer canastas para pan, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y duda (fibra natural) para tejer sus canastas. Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Maris has been part of the credit group Las Gaviotas (The Seagulls) where she feels that she is among family since they all support each other and try to advance together.

She lives by the Baños en Cuenca parish, which is an attraction due to its hot springs that have been exploited for pools and hotels attended by thousands of national and international tourists. There are beautiful landscapes and paradise-like places. The people are warm and have kind and gentle hearts.

Maria is 42 years old and separated but in a common law marriage. She has 4 adult children. Two are married and live independently, and her two single daughters work.

Maria rears pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She also weaves baskets for bread, which she learned from her parents. She will invest the loan into the purchase of chickens, pigs, and natural fibers to weave baskets. Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and natural fiber

loans.name: Palmeras De Sapahaqui Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALMERAS DE SAPAHAQUI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, producción de fruta, artesanía en trenzado de canastas, producción de canastas, producción de hortalizas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que desde niño ella apoyo a su familia y por ello conocía este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semilla por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo cultivará en su estancia para poder comercializarlo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Palmeras de Sapahaqui" communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional office. The group is made up of eight members and is lead by a board of directors, of which Señora Juana is the president. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied, and include fruit sales, fruit production, artisanal basket weaving, basket production, and vegetable production. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small microbusiness owners like Juana. She indicates that this is the first time that she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a representative of the institution who came to visit her house. Currently, she has a fruit production business. She states that she started this business on her own initiative; she has helped support her family since she was a child, so she knew the business.
 
The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to purchase seeds at wholesale; she will acquire them from the wholesale vendors of the city of El Alto and later cultivate them on her farm so that she can sell the produce. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy seeds at wholesale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia desde hace 06 años junto con su cónyuge e hija de 16 años de edad, quien estudia en colegio nacional del distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero y ofrece a la venta leche fresca y quesos su esposa prepara artesanalmente, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados que permitan al ganado vacuno producir mayor cantidad de leche, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is 56, in a common law marriage, and lives with his partner and 16-year-old daughter in his own house, where he has lived for six years.  His daughter studies at a national school in the district of Lagunas.  This community, whose population farms, engages in commerce, and raises livestock, is located in the province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region of northern coastal Peru.  

Isabel raises dairy cattle and sells fresh milk and artisanal cheeses that his wife makes.  He has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritious feed to increase the cattle's' milk production which will increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed to fatten her animals

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
The dairy business has been going on in Kenya for an innumerable number of years, but it is not at all being done professionally. Most rural farmers are interested in dairy since it requires no formal education and has been in vogue since times immemorial.

However, Eunice wants to be part of the change by venturing into a professionally-run dairy farm. She is a mother of two who lives in Kisii, a small rural town in Kenya which is not far from Maasai land. She has been doing mixed farming for seven years. She generates income selling eggs, tea, and a variety of greens from her farm. She also engages in other personal businesses.

Eunice is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She is very excited about the new opportunity to venture into dairy farming. Marketing of the end product which is milk is very easy as compared to any other business with no expenses incurred for marketing channels. No shop is required. However, one of the major challenges farmers deal with in Kisii is poor roads.  

Eunice is going to spend the money she is going to make from dairy farming to pay for her children’s education. Through education, her children are going to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
The dairy business is an important source of subsidiary income to small and marginal farmers and agricultural laborers in rural Kenya. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial and technical support to farmers such as Wilson, a father of five, in Ndaragwa.

Wilson has been a mixed farmer for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and food crops. Ndaragwa has a cool climate with a long dry spell each season. The drought accounts for the majority of crop failures experienced in this region leading to starvation.

Wilson is seeking a loan to purchase a high quality dairy cow. Easy availability of feed and fodder all year round makes dairy farming an ideal choice of investment in this region. He is very passionate about dairy farming. When crops failed in the past, he relied upon milk production to keep his family afloat. Dairy farming is not dependent upon rainfall. Dairy farming is always possible even when there is no rainfall whereas agriculture is exclusively dependent on rainfall. 

With your loan, Wilson will benefit in more ways than increased milk production. He will get manure which will provide a good source of organic matter for improving soil fertility and crop yields. The bio-gas from the dung will provide fuel for domestic purposes. The surplus fodder and agricultural by-products shall be gainfully utilized for feeding the animals.

Extra money from dairy farming will meet his highest monthly expense which is school fees. The family at large will enjoy advantages that will come along with increased income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Muzusa Group

texts.fr: Madame Yongo, mère de 8 dont seulement 5 vont à l’école, est membre de l’association de crédit Muzusa. Agée de 35 ans, elle est mariée à un homme sans profession. Il ya 7 ans qu’elle avait reçu de son frère une aide qui avait constitué son fonds de déroulement avant de regagner Hekima. Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour acheter 1 sac de farine, 10kg de sucre, 1 bidon d’huile végétale et d’autres ingrédients pour la préparation des beignets. Elle a comme objectif de  devenir une grande commerçante et ainsi elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Mrs. Yongo is a member of the Muzusa credit association, she has eight children. Only five attend school. She is 35 years old and married to a man who does not have a profession. Seven years ago her brother gave her pecuniary aid which she used as working capital before joining Hekima. She requests a new loan to buy one sack of flour, 10 kg of sugar, one can of oil and other ingredients for the preparation of fritters. Her aim is to become a big storekeeper and she therefore thanks Hekima for helping businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy one sack of flour, 10 kg of sugar, one can of oil and other ingredients for the preparation of fritters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de Enfermería, con ella pretende ayudar a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud, ya que siempre quiso poder ayudar al prójimo, es por ello que se está esforzando.
También por medio de su carrera quiere ayudar a su familia, para poder retribuirles todo lo que hicieron por él. Es una persona que se está esforzando por cumplir sus metas. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que implica un gran gasto y quiere poder cubrirlo por medio de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Nelson is from the city of Villarrica where is studying Nursing. With this, he hopes to help people who need medical attention, because he always hoped to be able to help his fellow man. For this reason, he is making such an effort. 

Also, with the help of his major, he wants to help his family and to be able to pay them back for everything they have done for him. He is a person that is trying hard to acheive his goals. He is asking for this loan to be able to cover his graduation expenses, because it implies a large cost, and he would like to be able to cover it with this loan.

loans.use: to pay graduation expenses.

loans.name: Abejitas De Tilata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ABEJITAS DE TILATA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magali es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de papa, venta de salchipapas (comida), venta de condimentos, tienda de artículos varios, tienda de ferretería, venta de comida, servicio de internet.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Magali es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que le apoyaba desde niña, hace tres años decide alquilar un espacio para implemento este negocio y trabajar de forma independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrigerador) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los beneficios médicos que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Abejitas de Tilata will start its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela, it is composed of 8 people and is headed by a committee in which Magali is the Secretary. The businesses of each member are varied and among them are the sale of food, sale of potatoes, sale of salchipapas (fries with hot dogs), sale of condiments, a hardware store, the sale of food, internet service.

The loan will benefit the microentrepreneurs where Magali is a member. She mentions that she has been part of Pro Mujer for six months and joined during a large institutional promotion. Currently, she has a business where she sells food. She learned this business from her mother since she helped her as a child, and three years ago she decided to rent a space to fulfill this business and work on her own.

This loan is to increase the capital (purchase of a refrigerator) which she will acquire from stores in the city of El Alto and which she will then install in her business. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she is single and has a son.
 
When she is asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the medical benefits provided her by the institution.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas para bebe, venta de sacones para niños, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, artesanía en escobillas, venta de muebles, servicio de transporte, venta de ropa americana, venta de celulares, taller de costura

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de ropa; da a conocer que la comercialización de este  producto lo aprendió con su madre desde niña, ya que ella le apoyaba en su negocio, posteriormente a su matrimonio decide emprender un  negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Renacer” (To Be Reborn) is in its 17th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Communal Bank. This group consists of 10 members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Marina is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as making woven sweaters for babies, selling children’s coats, weaving blankets, selling food, producing handmade brushes, selling furniture, providing transportation services, selling American clothes, selling mobile phones, and managing a sewing workshop.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Marina. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house. Marina currently has a business where she sells clothes. She became knowledgeable about selling this type of product by learning the trade from her mother when she was a young girl. Marina helped her mother with her business, but after she got married, she decided to establish her own independent business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying clothes in bulk. She acquires her merchandise at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then sells the products from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Marina is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Marina said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Mulangane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muheha occupe le poste de trésoriere au sein du groupe de crédit Mulangane. Mariée à un maçon,elle est âgée de 53 ans et mère de 9 enfants tous scolarisés. Exerçant les activités de commerce il ya 8 ans, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour acheter  1 sac de farine, 10 litres d’huile, 5 kg de sucre et 1 sac de braise. Elle souhaite devenir une grande commerçante. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour toutes les actions de crédit en faveur des femmes commerçantes.
texts.en: Muheha, the [featured] client, is the treasurer of Mulangane Group. Married to a mason, she is 53 years old and the mother of nine children, all of whom attend school. Muheha has been in business for eight years and is seeking a new loan to purchase one sack of flour, 10 liters of oil, 5kg of sugar, and one sack of charcoal. Muheha hopes to become a great businesswoman and thanks HEKIMA for all its support of women in business.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of flour, 10 liters of oil, 5kg of sugar, and one sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay tuition and other education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Nyumbu Grp Group

texts.en:
Joyce, a business mother who is married and has school-aged children, is in her late twenties. 

For fifteen years now, she has had a business selling cereals like rice, corn, and beans. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy sacks of grain and corn for resale. She will share this loan with her loan group Nyumbu which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Her ambitions are to build a house for her cereal business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of grain and corn for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover tuition fees for her child to pursue a bachelor's degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil by the gallon in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es una joven de 23 años de edad soltera y sin hijos, tiene tres hermanos y toda la familia se dedica a la producción lechera, hace años aprendió a elaborar derivados de la leche, específicamente la producción de queso, “antes mis padres se dedicaban solo a la venta de leche ”, Yo aprendí la elaboración de 	queso ahora toda mi familia elabora Queso también les gustaría producir yogurt con el paso del tiempo creo que lo haremos, las metas de la señora Juana es mejorar su producción, aumentar sus productos y llegar a otros mercados,  Juana se siente decidida a mejorar su calidad de vida por eso solicita el crédito para la compra de un ganado lechero para mejorar su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juana is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She is single and has no children. Juana has three siblings and her entire family engages in milk production. Years ago she learned how to make products from milk, especially cheese. “Before my parents only sold milk, but I learned how to make cheese and now my entire family makes cheese. We also want to produce yogurt, so I think we eventually will at some point,” says Juana.

Her goals include improving her production, increasing her line of products, and selling to other markets. Juana is determined to improve her quality of life, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy another dairy cow. This will help to improve her production and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: Madame Bukaba est presidente du groupe de crédit Jipe Moyo à l’âge de 38 ans. Mariée à vendeur, est mère de 7enfants tous empruntant le chemin de l’école. Elle est vendeuse des produits divers et sollicite un crédit pour acheter un panier de tomates, 1 bidon d’huile de palme, 5kg d’arachide et 5 kg de sel en vue d’agrandir son entreprise, subvenir aux frais d’études des enfants et acquérir une maison. Elle remercie Hekima de  soutenir les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: Mrs. Bukaba is the president of Jipe Moyo Group and is 38 years old. Married to a salesman, she is the mother of seven children, all of them receiving an education. Mrs. Bukaba sells assorted goods and is seeking a loan to purchase a basket of tomatoes, one container of palm oil, 5kg of ground nuts, and 5kg of salt in order to expand her business, see to her children's educational expenses, and purchase a house. She thanks HEKIMA for their support of poor businesswomen.

loans.use: To purchase a basket of tomatoes, one container of palm oil, 5kg of ground nuts, and 5kg of salt.

loans.name: Flor De Los Andes Uno Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE LOS ANDES UNO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Damiana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, venta de pito, venta de verduras, servicio de construcción, venta de celulares, venta de comida, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de gorras, venta de matas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Damiana es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su esposo que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de juguetes; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace ocho años, al observar que este negocio tenía la ventaja de que era comercial en cualquier época del años. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de juguetes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se encuentra el esposo de una de las socias, él esta vestido con una campera celeste.
texts.en:
The communal bank “FLOR DE LOS ANDES UNO” will start its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de los Andes. It has eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Damiana is the Secretary. 

The members have a variety of businesses which include: selling books, whistles, vegetables, cell phones, meals, traditional skirts, hats, and plants; as well as construction services, and a neighborhood store. The loan they take out will benefit micro entrepreneurs where Damiana is a member. She states that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of her husband who is a client of the institution. 

Currently, Damiana has a business selling toys which she started eight years ago when she noticed that this business has the advantage of being busy at any time of year. The loan will be used to increase capital to buy toys at wholesale. She will buy them from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then resell them to customers who order them. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training offered by the institution. The husband of one of the members is In the picture above. He is in a light blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy toys at wholesale.

loans.name: Woussoupanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM représente le groupe WOUSSOUPANGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Elle fait la restauration depuis  12ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs d’haricot,  02sacs de riz et 03bidons d’huile.
Mme veut réinvestir ses  bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto et mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam represents the Woussoupanga Group. She is married and the mother of five children, the eldest of whom is 19 years old and the youngest of whom is six months old. Three of her children attend school, and she has six people in her care.

Mrs. Mariam has been in the food services business for 12 years. She gets her supplies at the local market. Mrs. Mariam wants to purchase two sacks of beans, two sacks of rice, and three containers of oil. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her goal is to purchase a motorbike and to better provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of beans, two sacks of rice, and three containers of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bed covers and different kinds of clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Sreymao, age 34, is the mother of three dependent children. To provide a living for the entire household, Sreymao sells various kinds of vegetables, coconuts and bananas. She has been in this business for the past 11 years. She earns about 43,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sreymao has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has successfully repaid the previous loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, Sreymao is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more coconuts and bananas to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a Cameroonian aged forty-eight, married with seven children. The oldest is twenty-three and in the university, while the youngest is one year old. He has been in this business for over eight years, which makes him experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase his profit by fifty percent.

loans.use: to buy a machine to patch tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is forty years old, divorced and has two children, one of whom is an adult. Nine years ago and with 500 TJS she began selling a variety of children’s clothes and shoes in a local market. Little by little she has developed her business and manages it by herself.

Gulchehra loves little children, and she tries to offer high-quality children clothes for her customers. She renews the assortment of goods every season. She is now applying for a 8,500 TJS loan to buy children’s clothes and shoes for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy children’s clothes and shoes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.en:
Idigul was born in 1963. She is married and is the careful mother of a child. Idigul lives with her family in South Tajikistan. She is a very hardworking and good-natured woman. She is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit story. 

Idigul is an entrepreneur. She has been selling children's clothes and shoes for more than 12 years. Idigul sells a variety of children's clothes such as shirts, trousers, shorts, t-shirts and more. 

With the loan, Idigul plans to buy children's clothes in order to widen her assortment of goods for the new season. She is asking for a loan of 8500 TJS to buy children's clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
The dairy business is one of the largest and fastest growing agri-businesses practiced in rural areas of Kenya. Johnson is a farmer in Ndaragwa who has been doing this work for 20 years!  To earn a living, this father of ten sells milk, eggs and a variety of greens from his farm at a local market. He observes the trends with keen interest and is ready to expand his dairy operations.

Johnson is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Demand for milk is increasing daily, from both cities and institutions. Milk consumption is on the rise for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.

Of all of the farming activities, Johnson finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable. Dairy farming is not directly dependent on rainfall, unlike crop farming, which can be fatally affected by drought. Extra money generated from the additional cow will go to his children’s education. His family will benefit from increased milk production, in terms of improved diet and increased income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store supply.

loans.name: Makara's Group

texts.en: Makara, originally from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, is 24 years old and a mother of one little kid. She earns her living via her occupation as a school teacher and her rice farming business, which earns her about 27,000 KHR per day. Makara is quite new to VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can prepare her land in a timely manner, so it will be ready for the upcoming replanting season.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase caustic soda and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2014 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS 2014”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de la Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena ella es conviviente y tiene 43 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, plátanos y cacao, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing the members of “Las Emprendedoras 2014” (Women Entrepreneurs 2014), a Communal Banks located in Quillabamba, a district of the La Convención province in the Cusco department.

Elena is a member of this group. She lives with her life partner, she is 43 and she has 3 children. She works in her own grocery store and she also engages in agriculture. She owns some land where she grows coffee, plantain and cocoa. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and oil, and she works for 8 am to 6 pm. She has been running her activity for 5 years and things are going very well: her dream is to improve her grocery store. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.
The other members run different activities such as selling meals, selling clothes, running a grocery store and running a restaurant.

Elena is thankful to those that will help her making her dream come true through this mean, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Luz De Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE AMOR” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, servicio de construcción, venta de celulares, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de gorras, venta de matas, costura de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su esposo que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace quince años, aprendiendo el mismo en un centro de formación y posteriormente decidió realizar trabajos esporádicos para sus amigas. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la educación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Luz de Amor Communal Bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which Marcela is the secretary.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including vegetable sales, construction, cell phone sales, food sales, a neighborhood store, cap sales, plant sales, and making polleras [traditional skirts].

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Marcela.  She said she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years, having joined on the invitation of her husband, who's a client of the institution.  Currently Marcela has a business making polleras that she started five years ago.  She learned the trade in a training center and later decided to do occasional work for her friends.

Marcela's loan is to increase her capital by buying fabric, which she'll get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell on customer request.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, because she's married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the education the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza was born in 1985. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a very hardworking and ambitious woman. Some people say that she has ‘golden hands.' Nargiza sews national woman clothes. She began her own sewing business three months ago. Nargiza serves clients in her house with an old sewing machine. She plans to develop her business and find success. Nargiza took part in a course for women, called ‘To Get Ahead,' and earned a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 500 somoni to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your assistance.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her knees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some arable land.

loans.name: Amudani

texts.en:
Amudani is a forty two-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices fishing to earn a living and, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Apart from that, he also owns a pool table, from which he earns money to support his family.

He hopes that in the future he will have educated children, though he faces the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand. He intends to use the loan to buy more nets for fishing and to pay workers.

loans.use: to buy more nets for fishing and to pay workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor, age 46, works very hard to support his family through his Zoona mobile money transfer business. He has three children, ages 21,19 and 10. All of his children are currently attending school. He has requested a loan from Kiva so that he can serve customers at a new location in Mandevu township, where mobile money financial service is needed in the community. 

Victor has been running his mobile money transfer business for four months. He says that his community benefits from the business, because it is affordable, user-friendly, and accessible. He currently works alone at his green trading booth and is hopeful that, once his business grows, he will be able to hire additional employees and expand operations. 

This loan will help Victor on the path to building a viable business that can provide for his family and community throughout the year. It is for this reason that Victor is asking Kiva lenders to help him, so that he can secure additional working capital and grow his business with more cash-on-hand.

loans.use: To provide essential transaction funds to service customers

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a thirty-six-year-old, hard-working, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in agriculture as her main source of income though she has other side businesses, including selling produce for extra income. She started this business to sustain her family and improve their standard of living. She faces the challenge of seasonal changes that affect her agricultural production. She has a dream of constructing a big, permanent house in the future.

She is requesting a loan to buy manure and mulch for her farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and mulch for her farm.

loans.name: Dutambutsanye Group

texts.fr:
Marc fait partie du groupe Dutambutsanye et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 40 ans  et est marié  à Apolline, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 18 dont 4 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge son neveu.

Il fait le commerce de bière, et de limonade dans son bistrot  depuis  10  ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  caisses de  bière et de limonade à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait acheter une parcelle , une voiture pour son déplacement et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Marc is a member of the Dutambutsanye Group. He is 40 years old and lives in Bujumbura. He is married to Apolline, a farmer, with whom he has had five children between the ages of one and 18. Four of them are currently receiving an education. In addition to this, his nephew is also under the family's care.

Marc has been selling beer and lemonade out of his café for the past 10 years. 

This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, his working capital will be increased and he will purchase several cases of beer and lemonade, which he will resell at a profit.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a plot of land and a car to get about in. He would also like to see that his children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase several cases of beer and lemonade, which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, tiene la edad  de 62 años, está soltero,  vive con su hermano y se ayudan mutuamente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de maíz de buena calidad y con un alto porcentaje de geminación  y con esto asegurarse de tener un cultivo uniforme y de fertilizantes adecuados para este tipo de plantación y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra  en la preparación del terreno a sembrar y en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de este cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Fernando is 62 years old and single.  He lives with his brother and they help each other out.  With this loan he aims to purchase corn seeds of good quality and a high percentage of germination.  With these types of seeds he can be sure to have a uniform crop and fertilizer suitable for this type of planting and other products to apply to the seeds.  He also will pay for labor in the preparation of the ground for sowing and application of products and planting assistance once it is developed.  This will make sure he will realize a good job.  His aim is to take advantage of the good climate conditions and soil that the zone relies on for this crop and also be able to put into practice the experience of many years in the management of this crop.  Also, to be able to buy the best products of the best quality means that his crops will have good development and health.  This is equal to an adequate harvest and to have an important production in the short term.  With the earnings from the harvest he hopes to utilize them for the well being and studies of his family as well as to meet some family goals and continue inverting more into crops.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has never had other loans before in state  banks, but FUDECOSUR has given the loan with much ease and a much lower level of interest.

loans.use: to seed corn.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El  señor Juan,   es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltero, vive con sus padres, es una persona muy trabajadora, que se dedica a ser macatero (vendedor ambulante), vende artículos de mercerías en general, como herramienta de trabajo tiene una moto que lo ayuda en sus repartos.
Es un señor muy trabajador y muy responsable, que quiere seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de artículo de mercerías varios, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Juan is from the city of Santani.  He is single, lives with his parents and is a very hard working man that dedicates himself as a street vendor.  He sells sewing supply articles in general.  As a work resource, he has a moto which helps him make deals.  He is a hard working man and responsible.  He wants to continue working to be able to help his family.  He requests this loan to purchase various sewing supplies so that he can continue with his sales and can meet the orders of his clients.

loans.use: to buy sewing supply articles to sell.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren is a villager from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is a 45-year-old married mother blessed with five children. Only one of her children attends school. She supports her household through a single source of income, rice farming, which she has worked in for 15 years. Currently, she earns about 37,000 KHR per day. She has engaged with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for ages, including five past cycles with successful repayment and now her living condition is improving. Now, she is the leader of a group of three. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She believes that she can yield a better crop than before.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee and to buy fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a thirty-two-year-old married woman with three children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She is a poultry farmer and that is how she earns a living. She also carries out other agricultural activities to earn extra income. She started this business to earn more income for the betterment of her family. She faces the challenge of chicken pox that attack her birds. However, she has a vision of expanding her business and educating her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
Norm, a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, is 56 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids. To tackle financial burdens and secure the basic needs for her entire household, she runs a small grocery stall for a living. The stall generates about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Norm has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles and has successfully completed repayment. Her living conditions are improving, as a result of the positive impact of her past loan. Now, she is the leader of a group of three women. She and one of her co-borrowers are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining borrower is applying for 800,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her business quickly.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more waxed cotton, lace and different kinds of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTIDAS” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de matas, venta de ropa, ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de ferreteria; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, con el apoyo de una amiga que la guío en la adquisición y el comercio de estos productos
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de herramientas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta todos los días con el apoyo de su hijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Concentidas communal bank will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional center.  It is comprised of nine members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Silveria is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and among them are selling vegetables, selling food, selling traditional skirts, a neighborhood store, selling plants, selling clothes, and a hardware business.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Silveria is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution.  She currently has a business, a hardware store.  She indicates that she set up this business several years ago.  She did so with the support of a friend who guided her in getting and selling these products.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital (to buy tools wholesale).  She will get them from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell them at her place of sales, where she works every day with the help of her son.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is a widow, and she has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy tools wholesale.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia Carmen Luz se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de prestar servicio de movilidad, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Luz continues to dedicate herself to selling clothing.  She also dedicates herself to her transportation business.  She sells pants, blouses and polo shirts.  She has many years in this business and it has gone very well for her.  Her dream is to have a marketplace.

She is seeking a loan to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.  She is very happy for the loan and she is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia Martha Cecilia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vinos y licores,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia lleva vinos y licores a distintos lugares como empresas y amigos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender vinos y licores.La socia solicita el credito para comprar vinos y licores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia dedicates herself to her business selling wines and spirits.  She has been in the business for many years and it has gone very well for her.  She delivers wines and spirits to various places such as businesses and friends.  She works from 8am to 6pm.  Her dream is to have a retail location where she can sell her wine and spirits.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase wines and spirits.  She is very happy for the loan and she is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase wine and spirits.

loans.name: Yolima

texts.es: Desde muy joven Yolima, mujer viuda y madre de 1 pequeño de 8 años, conoció la actividad comercial en su hogar paterno, pues tradicionalmente han estado involucrado en la venta de productos de a canasta familiar en pequeñas proporciones,  como la clientela lo exige para su consumo diario. Educada en este ambiente comercial, Yolima cuando fue adulta decidió dedicarse a lo mismo y hoy es la propietaria de una tienda, que inició en el año 2010, y está ubicada en el suroccidente de la ciudad. Ella vende directamente a sus clientes  de contado y a crédito todos los días desde  las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. En su oferta se encuentran los víveres, ranchos, refrescos, lácteos, granos  y licores, que compra de contado a proveedores mayoristas. Las tiendas son usualmente el sitio de concentración de las amas de casa principalmente, donde comparten conversaciones comunes, antes de iniciar su tarea de hogar y esto es justamente lo que hace que su clientela la conformen los habitantes de las comunidades del barrio, quienes son su objeto de atención y servicio. Su meta es convertir su pequeña tienda en un autoservicio  y a futuro comprar un vehículo, pero su mayor desafío son lograr aumentar sus ventas, incrementar sus utilidades y ahorrar.  En la actualidad Yolima necesita aumentar su surtido para empezar el camino de logros y esto es justamente lo que va a hacer con un credikiva, al que está aplicanespera que sus ventas mejoren, pues el surtido será mucho mas abundante.
texts.en:
From a very young age Yolima, a widow and mother of an 8 year old child, learned about business activity in her parents' house, since they were traditionally involved in the sale of products for basic family needs in small portions, as customers required for their daily consumption. Educated in this business environment, Yolima, when she became adult, decided to make a living doing the same thing. Today she is the owner of a store which she opened in 2010 that is located in the southwest part of the city. She sells directly to her customers for cash or credit every day from 6am until 9pm. Her range of products includes food provisions, snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, grains and liquors, which she buys for cash from wholesalers.

Stores are normally the gathering places for the housewives principally, where they share casual conversation before beginning their housework. This is exactly why her customers are made up of the residents of the communities in the neighborhood, who are the object of her attention and service. Her goal is to convert her small store into a self-service restaurant, and, in the future, buy a car. However, her greatest challenges are to increase her sales, to increase her earnings, and to save. 

Currently, Yolima needs to increase her product range to begin the path to her success, and this is exactly what she is going to do with the credikiva she is applying for. She hopes that her sales will improve since her range of products will be much more abundant.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, grains, fruits and vegetables, meats and soft drinks

loans.name: 29 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “29 DE MAYO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Steffi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de guantes, costura de gorras, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de mochilas, venta de helados, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Steffi es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, ya que desde niña apoyaba a su familia en el comercio de este producto. Ella comenta que este producto es requerido en el mercado Alteño para el akullicu . 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de coca por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, los créditos y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "29 de Mayo" is entering its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of its Senkata regional office.  The group is made up of eight members and it is led by a board of directors on which Steffi is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied and include clothing sales, glove sales, sewing hats, baby clothing sales, backpack sales, ice cream sales and coca sales.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small business where Steffi is a member.  She states that this is the first time that she takes part in Pro Mujer, joining after receiving an invitation from a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling coca.  She states that she started the business many years ago because since she was little, she helped her family sell this product.  She comments that the product is requested in the Alteño market for akullicu (chewing of coca leaves).

The loan that she is seeking will be used to increase her capital (purchase coca in bulk) that she will acquire in the markets in the city of La Paz and later sell in her retail space.  This line of work allows her to earn an income to support her family since she is single and lives with her parents.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the health center, the loans and the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase coca in bulk.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny is a 54-year-old villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province and a mother of two schoolchildren who still need her support. Her business of rice growing and cassava farming is the main source of income for her family, generating about 34,000 KHR per day. 

A new member of Kiva partner VisionFund, Ny has formed a group of two to request a loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She believes these purchases will result in a better yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de canastas, venta de ropa, venta de coca, tejido de macramé de mantas, costura de mochilas, tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bertha es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una campaña masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de abarrotes; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, al observar que este negocio era muy solicitado en el mercado paceño. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Flor Kantuta communal bank is entering its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It consists of eight members and is headed by an executive board where Mrs. Bertha is President. The various members of the community bank work in basket weaving, macramé woven blankets, and sewing bags, selling clothes and coca, and general neighborhood and transportation businesses.

The loans benefit small microentrepreneurs where Mrs. Bertha is a member. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years after she accepted an invitation from the institution. Today she has a grocery store business which she started several years ago, as this business was highly sought after in the La Paz market.
 
The loan will allow her to earn increased capital, as she can buy wholesale groceries from vendors of the city of El Alto and subsequently sell them in her own retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training and health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Ericka Rosa

texts.es: Doña Ericka se ha ganado la vida vendiendo ropa, trabajando como empleada domestica para sacar adelante a sus hijos siendo madre soltera, hoy en día se desempeña como costurera siendo sus servicios el sustento de la familia, doña Ericka no ha podido culminar las mejoras en su vivienda, tiene aún pendiente de terminar el muro frontal de su casa,   solicita el crédito para poder comprar los materiales de construcción y el pago de la mano de obra, esto con el objetivo de garantizar la seguridad familiar gracias al apoyo de financiamiento a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Erika has earned a living selling clothing and working as a maid to get her children ahead as a single mother.  Today, she works as a seamstress.  Her services allow her to provide for her family.  Erika has not been able to complete the repairs in her home.  She still has to finish the front wall of her house.

She is seeking a loan to purchase construction materials and pay for labor, all with the goal of providing security for her family thanks to the financial support.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar and cinder blocks to build a front wall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase crabs and crayfish from his neighbors to promote business and productivity in this small town.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year-old, hard-working man, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in produce, selling maize and coffee as his main source of income, although he also practices agriculture, where he earns an extra income. He started this business to earn a living and have a better standard of living. He has the challenges of poor roads and the unpredictable weather changes that affect his produce business. However, he has a vision of owning a big modern produce store in the future.

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 36-year-old, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes hinder his business, while his business plan is to own a food store.  He is requesting for a loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel se dedica a la compra y ventas de ropas, calzados deportivos, ya hace 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y lo realiza con su esposa.
Daniel y su esposa son una pareja muy sacrificada que está luchando por poder salir adelante, crecer, y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que después se fue abriendo camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de camperas y vaqueros, con lo cual podrá surtirse y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, de manera a seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Daniel makes a living buying and selling clothing and athletic footwear. For the last seven years he has pursued this activity along with his wife. Daniel and his wife are a very self-sacrificing couple who are striving to be able to move forward, grow, and have a better quality of life. He mentions that he started with very little but later began to open a path for himself.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of jackets and jeans, with which he will be able to supply his business and continue with his sales as he has been doing, and in this way continue to struggle on.

loans.use: to buy jackets and jeans.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Nan is 35 years old and a mother, blessed with three children. One is too young for schooling and one is in school. 

Nan grows rice and cassava as the main source of income and she has been with this business for 17 years. Nan is in the fifth loan cycle and her joint borrower is in her fourth loan cycle. With the successful repayment of her past loan, now Nan's living conditions are getting better than before. 

This cycle, her group is seeking a combined loan of KHR 2,500,000, of which her co-borrower is applying for a portion of KHR 500,000. 

As the leader, Nan will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and insecticide. She hopes that both her cash crops will allow her to make more income than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and to buy cassava seedlings, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Dalin's Group

texts.en: Originally from Battambang province, Dalin is 41 years old, and a mother blessed with two children. She earns a living via her occupation as a local doctor, and her pig-raising business, which she has occupied for 10 years. For ages Dalin has been involved with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner), and she has already taken eight loans with  successful repayment. Now, she wants to expand her pig-raising business. Hence, she teams up as a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy feed and five piglets for raising. She hopes that she can raise her pigs healthily, so she can sell them with a good price.

loans.use: to buy feed and five piglets for raising.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a hardworking, married man, with one child who is two years old and living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more cattle for fattening. He still faces hardships of foot and mouth disease that attacks his cattle and they end up dying. However, he still has a vision of owning a milk processing machine. He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 32-year–old, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a hardware shop as her source of income. She started up the business to earn a living. She has a personal goal of expanding her business, though she faces problems of seasonal customers and the high rate of competition.  She is requesting a loan to buy more construction materials like cement, nails, paint, iron sheets and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials like cement, nails, paint, iron sheets and others to sell.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es una hombre emprendedor, tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Santiago junto a su familia. Tiene dos maravillosos hijos por quienes siempre ha luchado para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace casi 5 años trabaja como Operario en una empresa de Servicios Generales, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a su labor y responsable.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una computadora para su menor hijo que está en etapa escolar, para que pueda realizar sus tareas con mayor tranquilidad y mejorar su nivel de vida, con esto él se sentirá tranquilo y seguirá esforzándose por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is an entrepreneur man. He is 42 years old, single and lives in Santiago, along with his family. He has two wonderful children, and has always fought to improve their quality of life and give them a better future.

For the last five years he has worked as an operator at a company of general services. He does well at his job because he’s a hardworking, dedicated and responsible person.

Juan is thankful to Kiva lenders. With the support they have given him, he will be able to buy a computer for his younger son, who is still attending to school. It will facilitate his homework and improve his living standards. With it, he will feel at ease and will keep making an effort for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Soeuy's Group

texts.en: Soeuy, 50 years old, is a resident from Sangke district of Battambang province, where she runs her business. She has two dependent children to support; both of them are in school. Her entire household relies on her business via selling sweets and her husband’s job as motor-taxi driver. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), She is an eight-time borrower and her joint borrower is a fifth-time borrower. The past loans have enabled her to uplift her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she requests a new loan in order to buy ingredients to make more sweets to sell including beans, rice, coconut, sugar, flour etc. She hopes that this financial aid will support her business, so as she can make more income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make sweets to sell like beans, rice, coconut, sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is 23 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents together in northern Tajikistan. Munira is a young business lady. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years. She feeds cows, and she sells milk to local people. Her customers are glad from her milk products. She feeds cows at her house where she has a big cowshed. Munira is going to develop her business, and in this way maximize the profits. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy cows for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Placidia

texts.en:
Placidia is an enterprising, married woman, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

She used her previous loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. She still has hardships of customers who delay payment and price fluctuations. However, her vision is to educate her children to higher levels and to own a wholesale cosmetics shop.

Placidia is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Amistad Eterna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMISTAD ETERNA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Santusa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos, tejido de mantas, ayudante de transporte, venta de sándwich, venta de abarrotes, venta de papel higiénico, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Santusa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una prima que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento recientemente al observar que este producto es ampliamente comercial en el mercado. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias mayoristas de las provincias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, los créditos y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Association  “AMISTAD ETERNA” will start the seventh cycle in Pro MUJER, as part of the Main Focus of Senkata.
 It is formed by eight members and it is run by an executive board where Santusa is the President. There are several business run by the different members in this communal association:  sale of refreshments, blanket weaving, transportation assistant, sale of sandwiches, sale of groceries,  sale of toilet paper, and sale of meat.

The loan they’re requesting will benefit little micro companies where Santusa is a member. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years. She joined after her cousin, who is a customer of this institution, invited her. In the present, she owns a meat business; she wants to let us know that she started this business recently after watching that this product is highly requested in the market.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her capital (wholesale meat purchase). She’ll buy it in the wholesale trade fairs in the provinces of La Paz, to sale it later at her shop. This job allows her to make the money to support her family, because she is married and has four children.
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she like the health field, the loans, and the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale

loans.name: Night Rosemary

texts.en: Night, who is an honest married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used her previous loan to buy more commodities to sell. She owns a retail shop as her main source of income, although she grows and sells produce as her side income. She has been able to sustain her family's needs from these businesses. She still faces challenges of high rental and license fees, but she has hopes of expanding her business into a big wholesale shop supplying Kamwenge Town. She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a 32-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, Bapi (aged 35 years), and three children in the village of Khagrabari in Maynaguri of Jalpaiguri district. She is illiterate and can sign her name only, whereas her husband received education up to grade 6. One of her children is receiving education and is in grade 7; the other two are too young for school. They live in their own kachha house (a house made of straw, bamboo and wood).

Ratna's husband has been involved in a business of renting musical instruments such as drums, orchestras, sound boxes, microphones, speakers, etc. for special occasions such as marriage ceremonies, birthday parties, different functions, etc. He has been involved in this business for the last five years, and this business is the only means of income for the family. He is well known in his locality for his honesty, simplicity and polite behavior. He wants to go ahead with his business with the help of these qualities. Now he wants to grow his business in order to satisfy his customers, and thus earn additional income for the family; to do so he needs capital, which he doesn't have.

For this reason, Ratna has come forward and asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner), who helps the needy rural women by giving business loans. She plans to purchase more decorative musical items such sound boxes, music systems and wires to grow her business.

She hopes to keep on expanding her business, which will change their present financial situation. She will be able to educate her children properly so that they can be established in life.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase more music systems, drums, and wires for her existing musical instruments rental business.

loans.name: Doeum's Group

texts.en:
Doeum, 53, is a resident from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. He strives for a living via rice farming as the main source of income and he catches fish to sell for extra income. This business earns him a decent income to support his living. 

Including this loan, he is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). He has completely repaid his past loan and it has enabled him to uplift his lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

Now, he teams up with a group of three to get a new loan. The total amount for his entire group is KHR 3,600,000, of which KHR 1,400,000 is his portion. 

As the leader, Doeum will spend his loan portion to buy rice seed and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees. He strongly believes that he can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Pramati

texts.en:
Pramati is a 35-year-old rural woman from the village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Pradip.  Together they are raising three children (one son and two daughters).  All of them are students.  Pramati studied up to grade 5 and was deprived of further education due to her parents' poor economic resources while her husband is illiterate and can sign his name only.
