So they are trying hard to provide good education to their children.

Pramati is a housewife and her husband is associated with a business of supplying building materials such as cement, stones, sand, etc. for building construction, to the retail shops in the market.

Pramati wants to develop her husband's business to generate more income to cover the family's expenses, which are growing by leaps and bounds now-a-days.  She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more stones to facilitate supply to the retail shops.  She believes that through diligence and endurance, she can improve the business.

In the future she wants to expand their business and go ahead with it in order to generate more profits to educate her children and overcome the financial crisis of the family.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for giving her financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more stones to expand their existing business of supplying building materials.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a rural woman of 44 years, who hails from a remote village, Khagrabari, at Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She is married and a mother of two young children (one son and one daughter).  She attended school till grade 3 and her husband studied up to grade 9.  Both could not continue with their studies due to financial crises in their families. They live in their own kachha house (built of bamboo, mud and straw).

Manati's husband Niren, aged 49 years, has been able to get ahead with his business of renting decorative musical items such as sound systems, microphones, sound boxes, drums, etc. for different occasions like marriage ceremonies, birthday parties, etc.  The business has the potential of becoming a good source of income. Thanks to his hard work and the support of Minati, he has been able to settle his business successfully and earns for the family household.

Now Minati is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to increase her stock of music systems and expand her business.  She hopes this will enable her to meet the customer's demand and at the same time bring good earnings for the financial stability of her family.  The additional income will be spent on her children's education and any rest will be kept aside to construct a decent, concrete house for them to live in.

They are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more sound systems, microphones and other decorative musical items for their existing business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 44 años de edad, se dedica en la comunidad del barrio donde habita, a ofrece el servicio de alquiler de máquinas lavadoras y tiene como principales clientes las mujeres vecinas de su barrio. Rosa tambien tiene otro negocio, ella prepara y vende almuerzos a transportadores de camiones y conductores de motocicletas que ofrecn servicios de transporte alrededor de la comunidad. Su meta actual es ampliar su servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, pues debe generar ingresos superiores, que le permitan comprar un equipo de computo a sus dos hijas, para sus estudios. Sus hijas se enecuentran en las edades de 15 y 16 años, y en su condicion de mujer separada, conforman su grupo familiar.  Desde el año 1995, Rosa tomó las expeirncias de negocio de su famila: El  servicios de comidas lo heredó de sus padres y el de lavandería lo adquirió despues de que su hermana sufriera una enfermedad  y cediera este negocio a Rosa, quien hoy trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde sin cesar, con el fin de hacer crecer sus negocios y apoyar con estudios de calidad a sus hijos. En la actualidad Rosa está aplicando a un creidkva, primer finacimeinto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 3 lavadoras, que apoyarán la capacidad productiva y competitiva de su negocio, aumentando su capacidad de atender a un mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and she makes her living in the neighborhood that she lives in. She offers a service of renting washing machines and her primary clients are the women in her neighborhood. Rosa also has another business, she prepares and sells lunches to bus and motorcycle drivers that offer transportation services around the community. Her current goal is to expand her service of renting washing machines, because it ought to generate a better income, which will permit her to buy a computer for her two daughters for their studies. Her daughters are 15 and 16 years old, and since she is separated, they constitute her family unit. 
Since 1995. Rosa has gained business experience from her family: The food service she inherited from her parents and the the launderette she acquired after her sister suffered an illness and gave this business to Rosa. Today, Rosa works from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening without break in order to make her businesses grow and support the quality education of her daughters. Currently, Rosa is applying for a loan, the first financing she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy three washing machines which will improve her productive and competitive capacity as a business, augmenting her capacity to serve a greater number of clients.

loans.use: to buy three washing machines.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1977. She is married and is a mother of five sons and daughters. Alia has been selling clothes at her house for five years, trying to provide her children with a better life and to cover their study fees. Her business was profitable, and she is now seeking to expand her business by adding a new collection of clothes, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is a very young married woman of 20 years.  She is married to Madan, 36 years.  They are blessed with one young daughter.  They live in their own house in the small village of Khagrabari in the district Jalpaiguri.   Shibani has a secondary education whereas her husband studied up to grade 5.

Shibani's husband owns and operates a car service, providing transportation, to earn a living for the family. Shibani is a homemaker who looks after her husband and child and does the household work.  She also helps her husband in his work but to maintain a family with such a small income is not easy though the couple never gets tired from working.  They need to grow their business in order to provide financial sustenance. They are planning to improve the business by having more motor parts, so they need capital.

With this aim, Shibani asked for a loan from BJS.  She wants to utilise the loan to purchase more motor parts, accessories, and servicing tools for their car servicing business. She hopes the loan will help to improve the business and thus generate more income to improve the general living conditions of the family.

In the future, they want to buy a car with the profit for their personal use as well as to rent it out as another means of income.

Shibani thanks her lenders and BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts for their motor servicing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, chicken, pork and diapers for re-selling.

loans.name: Lachy's Group

texts.en:
Lachy is 30 years old and a villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is married and blessed with five children, three of whom are in school.  She earns a living via rice farming on one hectare of farmland and plantation. To supplement her income, her family relies on catching fish for resale as well. She has been with these businesses for 10 years, earning about 33,000 KHR per day. This is not the original loan for Lachy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

For this cycle, she is leading a group of three to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy good rice seed and to pay plowing fees. She truly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a twenty-five-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a retail shop business from which he earns a living. He started this business to look after his family. He has hardships of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and competition from other business people around him, while his dream is to diversify his business so that he can reap more profits.

He intends to use the loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, sodas and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, sodas and other items to resell.

loans.name: Kina's Group

texts.en: Kina, 43 years old, and a mother of three kids, is a local farmer who lives in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, where rice cropping is the most popular crop in the area. Kina also grows rice as her main business and also works for others for fees by wrapping grilled fermented fish called “Sorngvak”, which is one of well-known foods in Battambang province. She has been involved in her current business for several years and it earns her about 23,300 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Kina and the other two borrowers in the group of three. She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the representative of her group, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to own a hygienic latrine to improve sanitation practices in her household.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Lydiane

texts.en: Lydiane is a Cameroonian, aged 39, and married with two children; the oldest is thirteen years in secondary school while the youngest is three in primary school. She has been in this business for four years, which makes her very experienced, and her business successful. Her business is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase her turn over by forty percent and her profits will be increased considerably.

loans.use: to buy material cloth to sew and sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 20-year-old, single man from Gaza. His family owns a store for car accessories. He has been working in this store for the past three years. It is a very good business and the demand is high.  Ahmad would like to improve his store and expand it in the future. Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more items for his store like engine oil and some accessories. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his store and increase the sales. Ahmad appears in the photo while he was in the car accessories store.

loans.use: to buy more items for his store like engine oil and some accessories.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom was born in 1974. She is divorced. Dilorom is a careful mother of two children. She is a seamstress. Dilorom has her own workshop where she provides services to her clients and also teaches some girls sewing. She has worked in this field for more than 3 years. 

Dilorom is the only income provider for her two children. Dilorom’s daughter studies at the Metallurgical College. She is a first course student. Dilorom must pay the tuition of her daughter, so she is a borrower of IMON. She is asking for a loan of 300 USD to pay the tuition of her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay the tuition of her daughter

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en: Hanadi is a 39-year-old, single woman from Qabatiya, a small village near Jenin city. She works as a farmer on the family land where she has planted olive trees. This business earns a very good income, but is seasonal due to the harvesting season.  Hanadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for her farm. By taking this loan, Hanadi will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. Hanadi appears in the photo on her farm.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Hilber Eduardo

texts.es:
Hilber tiene 38 años de edad  de estado civil soltero vive con su conviviente en la comunidad La Palmira en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Hilber se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y a la elaboración de panela. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Chillanes. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y producción en la venta de la panela. Su desafío es contar con un recurso económico. En su tiempo libre hace deporte.
texts.en:
Hilber is 38 years old and single, living with his partner in the community of La Palmira in the Chillanes canton of the Bolívar province. He is an integral member of the solidarity group LA PALMIRA which is located in the community of  La Palmira. It is 40 minutes from the office of the cooperative composed of 14 partners from the same community, who all make a living in agriculture. 
Hilber makes a living in agriculture, the planting of corn and the production of cane sugar loaves. He is requesting this loan to buy manure, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and fungicide. He will make the purchase in Chillanes. His goal is to expand his harvest and the production for sale of cane sugar loaves. His challenge is to come up with economic resources. In his free time, he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a married woman from Beit Sahour, near Bethlehem city. She is a mother of three sons and three daughters. He husband has a factory for making souvenirs from olive wood. He sells them to the local traders where the demand for them is very high.

Linda helps her husband in his work and also prepares some handmade religious gifts. She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a sewing machine for her work. By taking this loan, Linda will be able to make a new type of religious gifts and sell them in the local market. 

Linda appears in the photo with one of her works.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her work.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives alone in a small house in the city. For the past year, Omar has been working at distributing accessories in the local market using his rickshaw. He buys them from the wholesalers and resell them.

Omar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell to the local traders. This will help Omar to increase his sales and also his income. 

Omar appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy more products to resell to local traders

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 22-year-old, single young lady from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Her father is an employee in a local firm. This is the only source of income to the family. Hala is a student in the university where she studies Multi-media. She would like to earn a BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses. Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the current semester installments. By taking this loan, Hala will be able to complete her studies and earn the BA degree. Hala appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the current university semester installments.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 28-year-old single young lady from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her family in a small simple house. She is an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income. She would like to improve herself and find a better job. Amal is also a student in the university where she studies Finance. She would like to take the BA degree and find a job to help her family in part of its expenses.

Amal took a USD 1,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the current semester installments. By taking this loan, Amal will be able to complete her study and take the BA degree. Amal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the current semester installments.

loans.name: Rowayda

texts.en:
Rowayda is a 43-year-old divorced woman from Bethlehem city. She lives with her four kids (three sons and one daughter) in a small simple house. She is an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income. She would like to improve herself and find a better job. Rowayda is also a student in the university where she studies for a master's in educational administration. She would like to take the master's degree and improve herself and also the family living conditions.

Rowayda took a USD 2,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the current semester installments. By taking this loan, Rowayda will be able to complete her study and take the master's degree. Rowayda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the current semester installments.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father is a teacher in public schools, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to complete his study and find a job in the future. Mohammad is a student in the university where he studies information technology. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of its expenses.

Mohammad took a USD 1,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the current semester installments. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his study and take the BA degree. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the current semester installments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to resell to local traders

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda was born in 1983. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an officer. Raeda has been working in making artificial flower arrangements for five years. She started her project by attending workshops where artificial flowers were made. One of the obstacles that she faced is not finding the needed sources to launch her work. Raeda is planning to put her products in showrooms and bazaars, so that she will get more sales in order to raise her income. Now she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy artificial flowers and pots.

loans.use: to buy new flower arranging materials like artificial flowers and pots.

loans.name: Santhanamullai Shg Group

texts.en:
Karpagam (27) is a married woman living in Kodalikarupur Village of Tamil Nadu, India. Her husband is a daily wage worker in agriculture fields. They have three children; all are studying in the local Government School. She is the group leader of the“Santhanamullai” Self-Help-Group (SHG), which has been receiving loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last five years. Her group has been making on time repayments.
Karpagam (who is standing, second lady from the left with her hand raised) and her group are requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a smokeless stove from Grameen Infra, a sustainable stove manufacturer. This small loan will be repaid in easy installments.

Household air pollution from open fires kills 4 million people every year and is one of the top health risks in South Asia. The Greenway Smart Stove reduces smoke emissions by up to 70% while requiring minimal fuel (can be in the form of wood, cow dung, or agricultural waste). Most importantly the stove reduces household air pollution, preserving the health of those who use it.

The 16 group members (Including Karpagam) are thankful to Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to be more sustainable and save money.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sakthi Shg Group

texts.en:
Chitra is 32 years old and resides in Aannaikudam, a small village in Tamil Nadu, India. Chitra is married to Senthilkumar and they have two children, both of whom are studying in Elementary School. Her husband is a laborer in agriculture fields but now is unable to sustain his family with his income alone.

Chitra (standing with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the 13-member “Sakthi” Self-Help Group (SHG). The group have been receiving micro-finance loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last four years.

Chitra and her group would like to take out a Kiva loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. Each group member is requesting  a small loan of INR 1400 which will be repaid in easy installments. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook-stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook-stoves. 

Chitra and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense all while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Kurinjipoo Shg Group

texts.en:
Kovandakurichi is a small village in Trichy district of Tamil Nadu, India. Anbarasi is the leader of a five-woman self help group called “Kurinjipoo.” They have been receiving microfinance loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last six years and have been making on time repayments. The featured member, Anbarasi (first from the left side with her hand raised), lives in her own home with her 3-year-old child while her husband works in a cement factory during the day.

Anbarasi  and the other four members of her group are seeking a loan to buy a smokeless stove made by Grameen Infra. This stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel and produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook-stoves.

Currently all the members of the group are using conventional firewood stoves. These stoves produce more smoke emissions and negatively affect their families’ long-term health. With a Kiva loan, members of the “Kurinjipoo” self help group will be able to purchase a smokeless stove and use less fuel while contributing to the longevity of their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Kaveri Shg Group

texts.en:
Jayanthi is the leader of the “Kaveri” Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT), which provides micro-finance loans. She has been receiving PAT’s support for the last three years.   

Jayanthi is married to a farmer and is living in Kallagam, a small village in Trichy District. She is 54 years old and has four children. To improve their farming they still receive loans from PAT and have been making on time repayments.

Jayanthi has recently learned about the Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that that reduces smoke emissions up to 80%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased smoke inhalation. Her group hopes to take a Kiva loan in order to buy this stove for the better livelihood of their families.

Jayanthi and her self-help group are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emission in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Dr.ambedhkar Shg Group

texts.en:
Latha (4th from the left in a brown saree) is a 31-year-old woman who is married with two children. Latha’s husband is a long-time farmer with many years of experience.

Latha has learned of a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra that uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Most members in her community use conventional firewood stoves in their kitchens, which causes 70% more smoke emissions than the smokeless stove. Latha wishes to be able to save money on fuel expenses as well as provide a good atmosphere in the house, devoid of caustic fumes.

Latha is a leader of the Dr. Ambedhkar Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in Kodalikarupur village of Tamil Nadu, India. She and the other 17 members of the group wish to request a group loan in order to buy this smokeless stove. They all are hoping to benefit from the lower fuel costs and safety of lower smoke emissions.

This is Dr. Ambedhkar group’s very first loan from Kiva. The group members are very excited about the opportunity to purchase this sustainable stove and wish to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Annaitherasa Shg Group

texts.en:
The Annaitherasa Self-Help Group is managed by the local NGO  “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). The group is made up of five industrious women who have been receiving micro-finance loans from PAT for the last three years. These loans have been extremely helpful in developing a better quality of life as well as in the cultivation of small crops. These loans allowed group members to increase their income and as a result, they have made prompt and on time repayments.   

Ariyur is a village in Lalgudi, Trichy District of Tamil Nadu, India. Here, Juliarani (standing in the middle, hand raised), the leader of the Annaitherasa Self-Help Group, lives with her husband Mariaarokiam and three children. Her spouse is a farmer by trade and her children are studying in school.

The group members are seeking a Kiva loan in order to purchase a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra. This stove would result in long term savings due to less money spent on fuel and would be less hazardous to their health due to reduced smoke emissions.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif is a 56-year-old father of five daughters. He lives with his wife and five children in a small village where they are involved in agricultural work in order to make a living. They plant different vegetables such as tomatoes and peppers that they sell in the market. Vaqif is requesting an AZN 1,000 loan so that he can purchase fertilizer and seeds for his land and to prepare for the upcoming farming season. This loan will help him and his family to have much more income and to provide for their needs. He hopes to continue to develop and grow his business so that he can achieve his goal of giving his children a better future. He wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for his land.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 26-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. He works in a coffee shop in the city, where he gets a low income. He would like to complete his studies and find a job in the future. Amjad is a student in the university where he studies engineering. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses.

Amjad took a USD 1,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Amjad will be able to use special programs for engineering to do his homework. Amjad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda is married with 3 children. She is 62 years old and lives in Tudela, Philippines. She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Rosenda has requested a loan to buy a sack of feeds, medicines and other supplies. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of feeds, medicines and other supplies.

loans.name: Johnah

texts.en:
Johnah raises pigs for sale in addition to her husband's income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the piggery business, and was able to sustain and improve it. To buy feeding supplies and additional piglets to raise, she took a new loan recently.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Elias Modesto

texts.es:
Elías tiene 69 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 42, 38 y 34 años en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Elías se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Chillanes. Su meta es comprarse un vehículo. Su desafío es la  influencia del clima y plagas en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la casa y a viajar.
texts.en:
Elias is 69 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and three children who are 42, 38 and 34 years old in the canton Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He is a member of the solidarity group La Palmira which is located in the La Palmira community about 40 minutes from the cooperative's office. The cooperative consists of 14 associates from the same community who work in agriculture. Elias work in agriculture and raises pigs. 

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, urea and fungicides. He will make the purchase in Chillanes. His goal is to buy himself a vehicle. His challenge is the influence of the climate and plagues on his crops. In his free time, he cares for his home and travels.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Shafy

texts.en: Shafy is a 21-year-old university student who is studying law, and he is in his third year. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation so that he will start supporting his family financially, but he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rean's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Thmor Koul district, Rean is 48 years old and married. She has five children. She is a rice farmer, while her husband is a construction worker. Having been in the farming business for almost 20 years, she currently can earn about 44,000 KHR per day.

This is the microloan for Rean with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Rean wants to use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Yoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurng is 27 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids, a school child and two under school-aged children. To make a living, she grows rice, and catch fish for sale. Her five years' experience in her current business allow her to earn about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Yoeurng is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success and now she can afford  three decent meals a day for her children.  For this cycle, she joins a group of three to get a new loan and she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion of 1,200,000 KHR  to buy rice seed, potash, and to pay the plowing fee for her crop. Moreover, she will spend some part of her loan to buy fishing materials to catch more fish. She hopes that she can earn more income so she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, etc. and buy fishing materials with a portion of the loan.

loans.name: Kov's Group

texts.en: Kov is a young married mother of one small child. She and her entire family reside in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where her single source of income is rice cropping. Kov is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Kov is the leader of a 4-member group requesting a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing fees. Kov hopes to earn more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Chheourn's Group

texts.en: Dambae district of Kampong Cham province is the home of Chheourn and her family. Chheourn is 60 years old and a widow. She struggles to earn money through her cassava plantation and crop farm, which have been the sources of income for about 40 years already. Chheourn has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles already and she has successfully repaid her past loans. Now, she is the leader of a group of two members and requests a loan of 4,000,000 KHR (an equal share of 2,000,000 KHR for each). As a group leader, she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fee and labor fee. She hopes that the loan enables her to expand her farming business in the hope of earning a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay land plowing fees and labor fees

loans.name: Ray's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Battambang province, Ray is a 42-year-old mother of eight children, two of whom are in school. To sustain this big family, pig-raising is the only source of income that she has managed for 25 years. It now returns her about 37,000 KHR per day.

Ray, a third-time time borrower, team up with a first-time borrower in the same group of two to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan allows her to upgrade her lifestyle progressively. 

For this cycle, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed and vaccination for her pig. 

She hopes that this loan will help her to raise her pig healthily so that she can sell it at a good price.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and vaccination for her pig

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a 27-year-old married mother of three children. She runs a small plantation business assisted by her husband and has been doing this for more than five years. She sells her crops and produce not only to the members of her village, but also to the public, selling her produce at the main market in town. 

Elisapeta plans to use this money to purchase a mist blower, wheelbarrow, chemicals, fencing wire, nails, and bushknives for her plantation. 

Elisapeta has been a member of SPBD for many years, and through her profits, she was able to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a mist blower, wheelbarrow, chemicals, fencing wire, nails, and bushknives.

loans.name: Đường

texts.en:
Mrs Đường works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Đường has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Đường is 41 years old, and she is married with three children. Đường lives with three dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đường’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Đường faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase bricks, cement and sand to build a new toilet.

With her business profit, Đường hopes for his business to do well, to build a new house, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Saidakhon

texts.en: Saidakhon is 22 years old. She is not married. Saidakhon is a sewer. She sews national women dresses and sells in a local market. She also sews and sells curtains. Saidakhon has worked in this way for more than a year. She already has her regular customers. Saidakhon helps her parents to buy all necessary things for living. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of TJS 1,500 to buy fabric for sewing more curtains. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing curtains.

loans.name: Aituava

texts.en: Aituava is a 39-year-old married mother of three children. She runs a small plantation business, which has been in existence for more than two years. She sells her crops to the villages or to the public, transporting the crops to be sold at the main market in town. She plans to use this loan to purchase taro roots, a mist blower, chemicals, bush knives, spades, shovels, and safety boots for her plantation business. Aituava joined SPBD to gain access to credit and she has managed to improve her family's living standards and provide a good education for her children with the profits she was able to make from her business.

loans.use: to purchase taro roots, a mist blower, chemicals, bush knives, spades, shovels, and safety boots.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil is 57 years old. He is a father to four children: the eldest has a job, two are in school, and the youngest stays at home. He has a business farming vegetables in the Agsu, and also earns additional income from selling honey. He is a very hardworking person. Adil has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. He is borrowing AZN 1,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Adil hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is 57 years old and married. She lives with her family in Agsu. Her parents also live with her because they are old and ill. Seda takes care of her  parents. She is a very positive woman. Seda is a market vendor. She sells food products like cakes, rice, and sugar, among others. Her store is set up in her house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where she very kindly tends to her customers. 

She has had this business for 10 years. Seda started with her own capital. Upon seeing the good results that her sales generated for her, she decided to continue her business. Now Seda is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar, and vegetables for her store.

loans.use: to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar, and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for 10 years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by purchasing mineral water and selling it at a low price. Beside a jeepney unit, she also manages a tricycle unit.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy more stock of other products needed in her business.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to increase her profit to add capital improvement. She also dreams for her grandchildren to finish their studies.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Note: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, age 41, is happy tending her little store. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. 

The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. Ana keeps on running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. Ana believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Ana has reached her 4th year being a member to Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of 3,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. 

She has confidence that she can maintain the label of a member in good standing. "It's already tested," she said. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari [convenience] store

loans.name: Buelah

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Beulah works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an upholstery shop, and a general store business. Beulah is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle for her tricycle transportation business.

Beulah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is a 23-year-old university student who is studying accounting, and he is in his fourth year. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation so that he will start supporting his family financially, but he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay semester and registration fees.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 22-year-old married woman. She deals in business, selling vegetables with her husband. She is very enthusiastic and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of two. She is responsible to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement for her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes, ginger and garlic. This will help her to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes, ginger and garlic.

loans.name: Zaibun  Nisa

texts.en: Zaibun Nisa is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past ten years. She has two cows, two buffaloes and five goats which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Qorichuspa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco se ubicado en Ccoto Huincho perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Hipolita ella es soltera  tiene 41 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la zona, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de artesanía, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a sus negocios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cerámicas, agricultura,  tienda de abarrotes, docentes.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Qorichuspa Communal Bank. This bank is located in Ccoto Huincho, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Hipolita. She is single, and she is 41 years old, with two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling food in one of the area markets, and at the same time, she sells handicrafts. She is a responsible, hardworking person.  She has had her businesses for a good while, and they are going well for her, thanks to the hard work that she puts into them every day.

The member wants to be able to continue working, and in this way, continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase supplies such as oil, rice, and similar items.

The other members devote themselves to businesses such as selling ceramics, agriculture, a grocery store, and teaching. The member thanks those who are part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as oil, rice, and similar items.

loans.name: Falasteen

texts.en: Falasteen was born in 1984. She is married and a mother of three sons and daughters in Jabal Alhussein/Jordan. Her husband is a retired man who is currently a driver. Falasteen has been supporting her husband in covering his children's needs for four years by selling clothes at home. As her business was profitable, she is now seeking to expand it by purchasing more clothes, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: 020603230003 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng does fishing. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing nets to go fishing and sell her fish.

Hằng  is 42 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 020603230003 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group solidarity group, which consists of three members. Hằng lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets for fishing and sell her fish in her stall

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married with one child who is an adult. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She is a retailer who has been selling sniffing tobacco for the last ten years. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

She is asking for this loan to buy more stock of tobacco for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tobacco for her business.

loans.name: Troush

texts.en:
Troush was born in 1964. She is married and the mother of eight sons and daughters in Southern Ghour/Jordan. Her husband is a retired man.  

She has been supporting her husband in covering his children's needs for one year selling clothes at home. As her business was profitable, she is now seeking to expand it by purchasing more clothes. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Above All Group

texts.en:
The Above All group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. They are into fish, foodstuffs, and wigs. 

The featured borrower of this group is named Mary. She is 41 years old with six children and is a single mother. Mary no longer lives with her husband. Some of her children go to school and some are working. Mary lives alone with her children. She is solely responsible for the family expenses. She did not go to school. 

Mary has been selling fish for 18 years in her neighborhood, which enables her to provide for herself and her children. She buys the fish from the fishermen and sells them to her customers. 

Hoping to improve service to her customers, Mary and the other members of the Above All group, request a twelve loan from ID-Ghana. This is the twelfth time that this group has requested financial help from ID-Ghana in order to raise the standard of their activities. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buy the fish from the fishermen and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a hard working married woman. She is the mother of three children and is keen to provide them with the basic necessities of life. She has been selling cloth for many years. She sells to the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy bundles of cloth for the summer season. It will help her to meet the increasing demands of her customers to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her seventh loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Amtel

texts.en: Amtel is 32 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Amtel's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She is a mother of four children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of PKRs 40,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her town. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 67 años de edad, vive con su hijo, en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como carneros, patos, gallinas y cuyes, desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de carneros para engorde y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is 67 years old, lives with her son, in her own house in a large community in the urban zone of Zaña and enjoys good personal and work references. Its population works in agriculture, business and animal husbandry, and is located in the province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

She has worked raising and selling small animals such as rams, ducks, chickens and guinea pigs for a number of years and has asked for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase rams to fatten and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rams to fatten and in this way create more income for her family.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Khashtarak village with her husband, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren (her grandchild Edita is in the photo). 

Susanna runs a farm which is not very large. She has one pig and 30 chickens. She wants to buy an additional calves for enlarging her livestock.  

Her agricultural activities also need improvement. Last season’s perfect potato harvest has made Susanna eager to continue potato cultivation. She currently cultivates corn, haricots, potatoes, and onions as well as grow some fruit trees. The requested loan of USD 1500 will be a huge support for Susanna and she waits for lenders' assistance.

loans.use: to pay for three calves

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a teacher with 30 years of experience teaching in the local school. She lives in a small village called Antaramej in the Lori region. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of six: 25-year-old son, husband, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. In the city there is a high unemployment rate, but a farm business helps the family have some stable income. Both husband and son are involved in their small farm.  

With the requested loan of USD 1500, Nina plans to purchase a new barn for keeping their livestock. The loan will be very a big support for Nina and her family and they all hope for lenders' assistance.

loans.use: to pay for a barn

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias, venta de artículos de plásticos, tienda de vidriería, venta de calzados, venta de poleras, venta de CD’s, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, al observar el amplio comercio y las diferentes gamas de productos que podrá comercializar en el mercado 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Amanecer" group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata, and is comprised of eight members and is directed by an board of officers, of which Lidia is the president.  The businesses that the group's members carry out are varied and include selling socks, selling plastic items, a glassware store, selling shoes, selling shirts, selling CDs, and transportation services. 

The loan that they take out ill benefit the small microenterprises of which Lidia is a member. She said that this is the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  At the moment she has a business selling clothing, she states that she began the business a number of years ago, upon observing the wide range of businesses and the different types of products that one could sell in the market.

The loan she now takes out is to augment her capital (purchase clothing in bulk) that she will get at the festivals in the city of La Paz and then she will sell it in her sales space. This type of work permits her to earn resources to support her family since she is single and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area the the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 30-year-old married man with only one child who lives with his family in Haja, Yemen. He has an elementary education, but he couldn't complete his study. He has a business making advertising for the stores, groceries and offices. He started in this business many years ago. Unfortunately, the capital of this business is still low, and the business lacks a lot of equipment and appliances.

For this reason, Adnan applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a printer and other appliances to improve his business.
Adnan looks forward to opening other offices in different parts of the city.

loans.use: to purchase a printer and other appliances to improve his business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 31 years old. She lives in the Senaki district with her parents and two children. 

Her parents are provided with the retirement pension and this is the only source of income for the five-member family. Nana decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1000 to start a retail business. 

She will purchase a stock of clothes and then will resell at higher price. This will enable Nana to provide better living conditions to her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem, age 32, is a married woman.  She sells animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices.  She also sells millet to generate an extra amount of income. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  She needs to improve her business to afford her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more animals. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grinder

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta lives in Aygehovit village with her big family: her husband, her two sons, two daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 

Greta is a farmer who is highly skilled in animal breeding and land cultivation. She has a mother pig and 20 chickens. Greta also cultivates corn, haricot, onions, and potatoes. Agriculture helps the family have a stable income during the year so it is very important for Greta to improve the business.

She asks for a loan of 850 USD to be able to purchase piglets, chickens, and forage for the livestock. 

The loan will be a great support for Greta and she will be very grateful for it.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, chickens, and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman, she has five children, four of whom attend school and one who is underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mbeyu operates a cereal and green grocery selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more of onions, maize, vegetables, beans, tomatoes, and rice for resale.  

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, maize, vegetables, beans, tomatoes, and rice for resale

loans.name: Marha Group

texts.en:
Rita is the featured borrower of Marha group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends, and their acquired loan will be invested in developing their family's living and businesses.

Rita is a 48-year-old divorced mother of two. She has worked hard for nineteen years as a tailor to support them in their living and covering most of their needs and requests. She has a tailor shop in a popular market, where she is well known and has a good reputation which is invested in attracting a good number of clients.

Rita is a hard worker, she puts so much effort into increasing her production to support her family in a well managed way. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy new updated tailoring machines that will help her increase her production in less time and higher quality.

She is the first lady sitting at the far right side of the picture with striped top. As for the other group members, Hanaa is the first from the left, while Nada is the lady sitting in the middle.

loans.use: To buy new updated tailoring machines to help her increase her production

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 40 years old and a married mother of two children.  

She deals in business selling cloth in her locality for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Kousar requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of good quality cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima was born in 1957. She is married and mother of three sons and daughters in Wihdat/Jordan. Her husband is a driver. 

Halima has been supporting her husband in covering his children's needs for five years by sewing clothes and selling them at home. As her business was profitable, she is now seeking to expand it by purchasing more fabric. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Subhanee

texts.en:
Subhanee is a 52-year-old married woman. She is running a business of "tandoor" (clay oven used for cooking in North India and Pakistan). She cooks chapattis and naan for the people of her community and also takes orders from nearby hotels. In this way she makes enough money to have a decent life. 

Subhanee is a mother of five and is motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It is her eighth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with its support. 

Now she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil. It will help her to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera was born in 1975. She is married and thevmother of four sons and daughters in Deiralla/Jordan. Her husband is a retired man who is currently a driver. 

Sameera has been supporting her husband in covering his children's needs for one year, selling blankets at home. As her business was profitable, she is now seeking to expand it by purchasing more blankets and clothes. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and clothes to resell

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 22-year-old university student who is studying Special Education, and he is in his second year. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation so that he can start supporting his family financially, but he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Nazran

texts.en:
Nazran is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor for the last four years.  She is a responsible mother of three children.

She is a well-known beautician in her town. She does her job passionately, and knows many techniques of makeup and hair styling. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams. 

The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams

loans.name: Laura Del Rocio

texts.es:
Laura tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 10 y 7 años en la comunidad Santa Teresita perteneciente al cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Laura se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y balanceado de engorde, los cuales los realiza en Chillanes. Su meta es incrementar el negocio de pollos. Su desafío es las enfermedades que afectan a los pollos. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Laura is 31 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and their children who are 7 and 10 years old, in the community of Santa Teresita which forms part of the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. She is a member of the communal bank LA PALMIRA which is located in the community La Palmira, 40 minutes from the office of the cooperative formed of 14 members from the same community who make a living in agriculture.

Laura makes a living in agriculture and raising chickens. She is requesting the loan to buy chickens and fattening feed, which she will get in Chillanes. Her goal is to increase her chicken business. Her challenge is the sicknesses that affect chickens. In her free time she likes to play sports and take walks.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Guadalupe se dedica al negocio de venta de piñas y al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría a las gallinas los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde se pueda vender las gallinas. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank, “Kimoyganakeramaganiroigi”. The bank is located in the district of Echarate, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco. 

The member, Guadalupe, sells pineapples and raises animals. She raises chickens, fattening them up and selling them later in different markets. She has been in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she could sell the chickens. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase chickens. 

The member is happy with the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is married and has two adult children. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mesaid has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RUBI” iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía de autos a escala, pastelería, venta de comida, venta de api, tejido de chompas y busos, venta de cosméticos, repostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hija que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  pastelería; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre y complementó su conocimiento en un centro de formación técnica para mejorar su producto. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de batidora) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las compañeras que encontró en la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "RUBI" will begin its seventeenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal del Collpani. The group is composed of eight members and is managed by a Board of Directors of which Martha is the president. The businesses in which the members of the communal association are engaged are diverse, among them are: hand-crafted model cars, bakery, food sales, api (non-alcoholic maize drink) sales, knitted sweaters and sweatshirts, cosmetic sales and confectionary.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Martha is a member. She says that four years ago she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of her daughter who is a customer of the institution. At present, she owns a bakery business. She tells us that she began to build this business several years ago, learning from her mother and supplementing her knowledge in a training center to improve her product.

The loan that she is requesting now is to increase capital to purchase a mixer, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and will later install in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family since she is married and has three children.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the colleagues she had met in the institution.

loans.use: to purchase a mixer.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Because Asma is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to take the picture instead. 

She is a 24-year-old married lady and mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband is running a store where he prints logos and pictures on souvenirs and clothes. He got this idea from his father-in-law when they were living in United Emirates. Later on, he bought the printing machine and moved to Jordan where he is currently running his business that is his only source of income. His business was profitable. Now he needs to purchase additional materials to be able to respond to his customers’ requests, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase printing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya lives with her husband in Dzoravanq village. The couple, as used to, is engaged in agriculture. They keep livestock and cultivate various vegetables and fruits. Marusya cultivates wheat, corn, haricot and potatoes. She also has apple trees and several plum and pear trees. Marusya's husband sells his garden’s harvest through the re-sellers or in the wholesale market. 

The requested loan of USD 2,800 is very important for Marusya and her husband to purchase agro machinery for transporting the harvest to the market. Please help this hardworking couple to develop their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for agro machinery for transporting the harvest to the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to renovate the family house

loans.name: Niniko

texts.en:
Niniko is 19 years old. She lives in Senaki district with her parents, sister, and pensioner grandmother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows, 2 calves, hens, and a pig. Her mother milks the cows every day and produces cheese products to sell locally as well as to use by the family.  In addition, they have nut trees and sell harvested nuts. 

Niniko decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1800 Gel to start a trading business. She will purchase a stock of clothes and will sell from home. This will increase the income of the family and Niniko will be able to expand the business in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTOCABLES” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Guillermina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salteñas, venta de ropa interior, venta de api, venta de pescado, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Guillermina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su esposo que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, al observar el alto comercio que tenía la venta de comida. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Intocables” (Untouchables) is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Guillermina is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling meat turnovers, selling undergarments, selling “api” (a beverage made from purple corn), selling fish, and selling food.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Guillermina. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six loan cycles ago after being invited by her husband, who is also a client of the organization. Guillermina currently has a business of selling food. She became knowledgeable about this type of business several years ago after observing that there was a high demand for the sale of food.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and then sells her dishes according to her customers’ orders. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Guillermina is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Guillermina said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy buttons and fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Angeles De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGELES DE SENKATA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sinforoza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de productos varios, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de verduras, venta de leche, tienda de barrio.
