El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sinforoza es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio y carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, conjuntamente con su familia, ya que el mimo es un negocio familiar; desde su matrimonio decide implementar un negocio independientemente 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de las provincias del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el área de crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Angeles De Senkata is starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. It is composed of eight members, and it is managed by a board of directors of which Sinforoza is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them there are meat sales, various product sales, electronic device sales, vegetable sales, milk sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan requested will benefit a group of small businesswomen of which Sinforoza is a member. She states that this is the first time that she joins Pro Mujer, joining because she was invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a neighborhood store and a butcher shop business. She states that she started this business several years ago with her family, since this business is a family business. Since her marriage, she has decided to start a business independently. 

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital by buying meat at wholesale from the fairs in the provinces of the department of La Paz, which she will subsequently sell in her retail space. This work allows her to earn an income and support her family, since she is married and has three children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health, training, and credit resources offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a hardworking woman who operates a tailoring business besides the fruit and vegetable business she has.

She is requesting a loan to purchase thread and clothing materials for her business. She appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase thread and clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is 25 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling seaweed in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of seaweed to sell.

Airene has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling seaweed for one year and also earns an income from fishing and buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of seaweed to sell

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is a 23-year-old university student who is studying Nuclear Engineering, and she is in her fourth year. She is planning to work in her field of study after graduation so that she can start supporting her family financially. But she doesn't currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 38-year-old married mother of five, who has been running her shoe selling shop for a year since she decided to start this business to assist her beloved husband with their family's income and to cover their increasing living expenses.

Zeinab sells shoes, bags, beauty products and accessories. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with the newly released special summer collection to cover her customers' special requests, and develop her newly established business in a well managed way.

Zeinab hopes that she can work on developing her business more by moving to a wider shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with the newly released special summer collection to cover her customers' special requests

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa, who was born in 1976, is a married mother of six sons and daughters. She has been trying her best to provide her children with a better life by running a small salon in a room in her building. 

As she has built a good customer base, Najwa is seeking a loan to expand her business by opening an independent salon so that she will attract more customers from her area and earn better profits.

loans.use: To move her business to an independent location and expand it

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, a mother of eleven children, and lives in Kaloleni. She sells green groceries, helped by her family. Mariam is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Mariam is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy  vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale
